parts: Everyone glorious in his father's house will trust in him, from small to great, and they will depend on him.

verses.text: In that day,’ says the Lord of hosts, ‘the man established in a trustworthy place will be removed and fall, and the glory that was on him will be taken away; for the Lord has spoken.’ ”
parts: In that day,’ says the Lord of hosts, ‘the man established in a trustworthy place will be removed and fall, and the glory that was on him will be taken away; for the Lord has spoken.’ ”

verses.text: To whom are the dwellers on the island likened—these merchants of Phoenicia, who cross over the sea
parts: To whom are the dwellers on the island likened—these merchants of Phoenicia, who cross over the sea

verses.text: in great waters, the offspring of merchants?
parts: in great waters, the offspring of merchants?

verses.text: Be ashamed, O Sidon; for the sea has spoken, the strength of the sea has said, “I do not labor in birth, nor bear children; neither do I rear young men, nor raise virgins.”
parts: Be ashamed, O Sidon; for the sea has spoken, the strength of the sea has said, “I do not labor in birth, nor bear children; neither do I rear young men, nor raise virgins.”

verses.text: Moreover when the report reaches Egypt, sorrow will take hold of them concerning Tyre.
parts: Moreover when the report reaches Egypt, sorrow will take hold of them concerning Tyre.

verses.text: Cross over to Carthage; wail, you inhabitants on this island!
parts: Cross over to Carthage; wail, you inhabitants on this island!

verses.text: Was this not your arrogance from the beginning, before it was handed over?
parts: Was this not your arrogance from the beginning, before it was handed over?

verses.text: Who purposed these things against Tyre?
parts: Who purposed these things against Tyre?

verses.text: The Lord of hosts purposed these things, to bring down all the arrogance of the glorious ones and to dishonor every glorious thing on the earth.
parts: The Lord of hosts purposed these things, to bring down all the arrogance of the glorious ones and to dishonor every glorious thing on the earth.

verses.text: Cultivate your land, for ships are no longer coming from Carthage.
parts: Cultivate your land, for ships are no longer coming from Carthage.

verses.text: Your hand is no longer able at sea, the hand that provoked kings.
parts: Your hand is no longer able at sea, the hand that provoked kings.

verses.text: They will say, “No longer continue to insult and wrong the daughter of Sidon, and if you cross over to the Citians, neither will you be at rest there.
parts: They will say, “No longer continue to insult and wrong the daughter of Sidon, and if you cross over to the Citians, neither will you be at rest there.

verses.text: And if you depart for the land of the Chaldeans, this also was desolated by the Assyrians.
parts: And if you depart for the land of the Chaldeans, this also was desolated by the Assyrians.

verses.text: Wail, you ships of Carthage, for your stronghold is destroyed!
parts: Wail, you ships of Carthage, for your stronghold is destroyed!

verses.text: Then it shall come to pass in that day that Tyre will be abandoned for seventy years, as the time of a king, as the time of a man; and it shall be, after the seventy years, Tyre will be as the song of a prostitute.
parts: Then it shall come to pass in that day that Tyre will be abandoned for seventy years, as the time of a king, as the time of a man; and it shall be, after the seventy years, Tyre will be as the song of a prostitute.

verses.text: Take a harp, wander about the city, you forgotten prostitute.
parts: Take a harp, wander about the city, you forgotten prostitute.

verses.text: And it shall be, at the end of seventy years, that the Lord will visit Tyre.
parts: And it shall be, at the end of seventy years, that the Lord will visit Tyre.

verses.text: Her trade and her wages will be holy to the Lord.
parts: Her trade and her wages will be holy to the Lord.

verses.text: And it shall be that the people shall be as the priest, the servant as the lord, the maiden as the mistress, the buyer as the seller, the lender as the borrower, and the debtor as the creditor.
parts: And it shall be that the people shall be as the priest, the servant as the lord, the maiden as the mistress, the buyer as the seller, the lender as the borrower, and the debtor as the creditor.

verses.text: The earth shall be completely laid waste and utterly plundered, for the mouth of the Lord has spoken these things.
parts: The earth shall be completely laid waste and utterly plundered, for the mouth of the Lord has spoken these things.

verses.text: The earth mourns and the inhabited earth is ruined; the lofty of the earth mourn.
parts: The earth mourns and the inhabited earth is ruined; the lofty of the earth mourn.

verses.text: The earth acts lawlessly because of its inhabitants, for they transgressed the law and changed the ordinances, the everlasting covenant.
parts: The earth acts lawlessly because of its inhabitants, for they transgressed the law and changed the ordinances, the everlasting covenant.

verses.text: Therefore a curse shall devour the earth, because those who dwell in it sinned.
parts: Therefore a curse shall devour the earth, because those who dwell in it sinned.

verses.text: The wine shall mourn, the vine shall mourn, and all the merry-hearted will groan.
parts: The wine shall mourn, the vine shall mourn, and all the merry-hearted will groan.

verses.text: The mirth of tambourines, the willfulness and wealth of the ungodly, and the sound of the harp have ceased.
parts: The mirth of tambourines, the willfulness and wealth of the ungodly, and the sound of the harp have ceased.

verses.text: They were ashamed; they did not drink wine; strong drink is bitter to those who drink it.
parts: They were ashamed; they did not drink wine; strong drink is bitter to those who drink it.

verses.text: Every city was made desolate; every house is shut up, that none may go in.
parts: Every city was made desolate; every house is shut up, that none may go in.

verses.text: Wail for wine everywhere; all gladness of the earth is gone!
parts: Wail for wine everywhere; all gladness of the earth is gone!

verses.text: Cities shall be left desolate, and abandoned houses will be destroyed.
parts: Cities shall be left desolate, and abandoned houses will be destroyed.

verses.text: All these things shall be in the earth in the midst of the nations, in the manner someone would glean an olive tree.
parts: All these things shall be in the earth in the midst of the nations, in the manner someone would glean an olive tree.

verses.text: They shall cry aloud, and those left behind on the earth shall be glad together in the glory of the Lord.
parts: They shall cry aloud, and those left behind on the earth shall be glad together in the glory of the Lord.

verses.text: Therefore the glory of the Lord will be in the islands of the sea; the name of the Lord, the God of Israel, will be glorious.
parts: Therefore the glory of the Lord will be in the islands of the sea; the name of the Lord, the God of Israel, will be glorious.

verses.text: From the ends of the earth we heard wonderful things, and there is hope for the godly man.
parts: From the ends of the earth we heard wonderful things, and there is hope for the godly man.

verses.text: Fear, a pit, and a snare are upon you who dwell on the earth.
parts: Fear, a pit, and a snare are upon you who dwell on the earth.

verses.text: It shall be that he who flees from the fear shall fall into the pit, and he who comes up from the midst of the pit shall be caught in the snare; for the windows of heaven are opened, and the foundations of the earth shall be shaken.
parts: It shall be that he who flees from the fear shall fall into the pit, and he who comes up from the midst of the pit shall be caught in the snare; for the windows of heaven are opened, and the foundations of the earth shall be shaken.

verses.text: The earth shall be completely troubled, and the earth will be completely perplexed.
parts: The earth shall be completely troubled, and the earth will be completely perplexed.

verses.text: The earth bends and will be shaken like a hut, and like a drunkard overpowered with wine; and it shall fall and be unable to stand, for lawlessness is upon it.
parts: The earth bends and will be shaken like a hut, and like a drunkard overpowered with wine; and it shall fall and be unable to stand, for lawlessness is upon it.

verses.text: Then God will bring His hand upon the host of heaven and upon the kings of the earth.
parts: Then God will bring His hand upon the host of heaven and upon the kings of the earth.

verses.text: They will gather them and close them in a fortress and in a prison; and after many generations they shall be visited.
parts: They will gather them and close them in a fortress and in a prison; and after many generations they shall be visited.

verses.text: And the brick will melt and the wall shall fall, for the Lord will reign in Zion and in Jerusalem, and will be glorified before His elders.
parts: And the brick will melt and the wall shall fall, for the Lord will reign in Zion and in Jerusalem, and will be glorified before His elders.

verses.text: For You made cities into a mound; You made the foundations of their strong cities fall.
parts: For You made cities into a mound; You made the foundations of their strong cities fall.

verses.text: Therefore the poor people will bless You, and the cities of wronged people will praise You.
parts: Therefore the poor people will bless You, and the cities of wronged people will praise You.

verses.text: For You were a helper to every humbled city, and a protection to those who were disheartened by reason of poverty.
parts: For You were a helper to every humbled city, and a protection to those who were disheartened by reason of poverty.

verses.text: They will bless You as discouraged people, thirsting in Zion because of ungodly men to whom You delivered us.
parts: They will bless You as discouraged people, thirsting in Zion because of ungodly men to whom You delivered us.

verses.text: Then the Lord of hosts shall do this to all the nations on this mountain.
parts: Then the Lord of hosts shall do this to all the nations on this mountain.

verses.text: on this mountain.
parts: on this mountain.

verses.text: Death prevailed and swallowed them, but again God wiped away every tear from every face; He took away the disgrace of His people from all the earth; for the mouth of the Lord has spoken.
parts: Death prevailed and swallowed them, but again God wiped away every tear from every face; He took away the disgrace of His people from all the earth; for the mouth of the Lord has spoken.

verses.text: Then it will be said in that day, “Behold, this is our God, in whom we hoped and rejoiced exceedingly; and we shall be glad in His salvation.”
parts: Then it will be said in that day, “Behold, this is our God, in whom we hoped and rejoiced exceedingly; and we shall be glad in His salvation.”

verses.text: For on this mountain God will give them rest, and the Moabite shall be trampled down, in the manner the threshing floor is tread with wagons.
parts: For on this mountain God will give them rest, and the Moabite shall be trampled down, in the manner the threshing floor is tread with wagons.

verses.text: He will spread forth His hands so as to humble man, to destroy him; and He will humble his arrogance—arrogance on which he laid his hands.
parts: He will spread forth His hands so as to humble man, to destroy him; and He will humble his arrogance—arrogance on which he laid his hands.

verses.text: The height of your refuge He will humble, and bring it down to the ground.
parts: The height of your refuge He will humble, and bring it down to the ground.

verses.text: Open the gates; let the people enter who keep righteousness and guard the truth,
parts: Open the gates; let the people enter who keep righteousness and guard the truth,

verses.text: and who lay hold of the truth and keep peace,
parts: and who lay hold of the truth and keep peace,

verses.text: because they hope forever in You, O Lord, the great and eternal God,
parts: because they hope forever in You, O Lord, the great and eternal God,

verses.text: who humbles and brings down those who dwell on high; the strong cities You will cast down; You will bring them down to the ground.
parts: who humbles and brings down those who dwell on high; the strong cities You will cast down; You will bring them down to the ground.

verses.text: The feet of the gentle and the humble shall tread them underfoot.
parts: The feet of the gentle and the humble shall tread them underfoot.

verses.text: The way of the godly is straight; and the way of the godly is prepared.
parts: The way of the godly is straight; and the way of the godly is prepared.

verses.text: For the way of the Lord is judgment.
parts: For the way of the Lord is judgment.

verses.text: which our soul desires at night.
parts: which our soul desires at night.

verses.text: The ungodly man ceases; he will not learn righteousness on the earth; he will not do the truth; let the ungodly man be taken away, that he may not see the glory of the Lord.
parts: The ungodly man ceases; he will not learn righteousness on the earth; he will not do the truth; let the ungodly man be taken away, that he may not see the glory of the Lord.

verses.text: O Lord, Your arm is exalted, but they did not know it.
parts: O Lord, Your arm is exalted, but they did not know it.

verses.text: O Lord our God, grant us peace, for You render everything to us.
parts: O Lord our God, grant us peace, for You render everything to us.

verses.text: O Lord our God, possess us; O Lord, we know no other besides You; we name Your name.
parts: O Lord our God, possess us; O Lord, we know no other besides You; we name Your name.

verses.text: The dead will not see life; neither will physicians raise them.
parts: The dead will not see life; neither will physicians raise them.

verses.text: Bring more evils on them, O Lord, on the glorious of the earth.
parts: Bring more evils on them, O Lord, on the glorious of the earth.

verses.text: O Lord, I remembered You in my hard circumstances.
parts: O Lord, I remembered You in my hard circumstances.

verses.text: As a woman with child is in pain and cries out in her pangs, when she draws near the time of her delivery, so we became Your beloved because of Your fear, O Lord.
parts: As a woman with child is in pain and cries out in her pangs, when she draws near the time of her delivery, so we became Your beloved because of Your fear, O Lord.

verses.text: We have been with child, we have been in pain, and we have given birth.
parts: We have been with child, we have been in pain, and we have given birth.

verses.text: The dead shall rise up; and those in the tombs shall arise.
parts: The dead shall rise up; and those in the tombs shall arise.

verses.text: Come, my people, enter your closets and shut your door; hide yourself for a very short while, until the anger of the Lord is past.
parts: Come, my people, enter your closets and shut your door; hide yourself for a very short while, until the anger of the Lord is past.

verses.text: For behold, the Lord is bringing wrath from His holy place upon the inhabitants of the earth, and the earth will uncover its blood and will not cover its slain.
parts: For behold, the Lord is bringing wrath from His holy place upon the inhabitants of the earth, and the earth will uncover its blood and will not cover its slain.

verses.text: In that day, there shall be a beautiful vineyard, and a desire to begin a hymn against a city:
parts: In that day, there shall be a beautiful vineyard, and a desire to begin a hymn against a city:

verses.text: “I am a strong city, a besieged city; I water it in vain; for it shall be taken at night, and its wall shall fall by day.
parts: “I am a strong city, a besieged city; I water it in vain; for it shall be taken at night, and its wall shall fall by day.

verses.text: There is no woman who has not taken hold of it.
parts: There is no woman who has not taken hold of it.

verses.text: Those who dwell in it will cry out, “Let us make peace with Him, let us make peace.”
parts: Those who dwell in it will cry out, “Let us make peace with Him, let us make peace.”

verses.text: Those who come are the children of Jacob.
parts: Those who come are the children of Jacob.

verses.text: As he struck, shall he not be thus struck?
parts: As he struck, shall he not be thus struck?

verses.text: Fighting and denouncing he shall send them away.
parts: Fighting and denouncing he shall send them away.

verses.text: Therefore the lawlessness of Jacob will be removed; and this is his blessing when I take away his sin, when they make all the stones of the altars beaten like fine dust.
parts: Therefore the lawlessness of Jacob will be removed; and this is his blessing when I take away his sin, when they make all the stones of the altars beaten like fine dust.

verses.text: The flock that dwelt there shall be left like an abandoned flock, and for a long time the field will be for pasture; and there flocks shall lie down to rest.
parts: The flock that dwelt there shall be left like an abandoned flock, and for a long time the field will be for pasture; and there flocks shall lie down to rest.

verses.text: And after a time, there will be nothing green in it because of the withering.
parts: And after a time, there will be nothing green in it because of the withering.

verses.text: And it shall come to pass in that day that the Lord will close it from the channel of the river to the Brook of Egypt.
parts: And it shall come to pass in that day that the Lord will close it from the channel of the river to the Brook of Egypt.

verses.text: So it shall be in that day that they shall blow the great trumpet, and the lost ones in the country of the Assyrians and in Egypt will come, and they shall worship the Lord on the holy mountain in Jerusalem.
parts: So it shall be in that day that they shall blow the great trumpet, and the lost ones in the country of the Assyrians and in Egypt will come, and they shall worship the Lord on the holy mountain in Jerusalem.

verses.text: Behold, the anger of the Lord is a strong and harsh thing, like a falling hail where there is no shelter, falling violently like a great force of water, sweeping away the country.
parts: Behold, the anger of the Lord is a strong and harsh thing, like a falling hail where there is no shelter, falling violently like a great force of water, sweeping away the country.

verses.text: The crown of arrogance, the hirelings of Ephraim, will be trampled underfoot.
parts: The crown of arrogance, the hirelings of Ephraim, will be trampled underfoot.

verses.text: But the flower that fell from the hope of the glory on the top of the high mountain shall be like the forerunner of the fig.
parts: But the flower that fell from the hope of the glory on the top of the high mountain shall be like the forerunner of the fig.

verses.text: In that day, the Lord of hosts shall be the crown of hope, woven of glory, to the remnant of My people.
parts: In that day, the Lord of hosts shall be the crown of hope, woven of glory, to the remnant of My people.

verses.text: They shall be left in a spirit of judgment upon judgment and for the strength of those who prevent slaying.
parts: They shall be left in a spirit of judgment upon judgment and for the strength of those who prevent slaying.

verses.text: For these are led astray with wine and are deceived by strong drink.
parts: For these are led astray with wine and are deceived by strong drink.

verses.text: A curse will devour this counsel, for this counsel was for the sake of covetousness.
parts: A curse will devour this counsel, for this counsel was for the sake of covetousness.

verses.text: To whom have we reported evils and declared a message?
parts: To whom have we reported evils and declared a message?

verses.text: Expect affliction upon affliction, hope upon hope, yet a little, yet a little.
parts: Expect affliction upon affliction, hope upon hope, yet a little, yet a little.

verses.text: By reason of the contempt of lips and another tongue they will speak to this people,
parts: By reason of the contempt of lips and another tongue they will speak to this people,

verses.text: saying to them, “This is the rest for the hungry, and this is the affliction,” but they would not listen.
parts: saying to them, “This is the rest for the hungry, and this is the affliction,” but they would not listen.

verses.text: The teaching of the Lord God will be for them affliction upon affliction, hope upon hope, yet a little, yet a little, so they may go and fall backward; and they will be in danger, crushed and conquered.
parts: The teaching of the Lord God will be for them affliction upon affliction, hope upon hope, yet a little, yet a little, so they may go and fall backward; and they will be in danger, crushed and conquered.

verses.text: Therefore hear the word of the Lord, you afflicted men and rulers of this people in Jerusalem.
parts: Therefore hear the word of the Lord, you afflicted men and rulers of this people in Jerusalem.

verses.text: Because you said, “We made a covenant with Hades, and are in agreement with death, and if the rushing storm passes through, it will not come upon us, for we made falsehood our hope, and in falsehood we shall be protected”;
parts: Because you said, “We made a covenant with Hades, and are in agreement with death, and if the rushing storm passes through, it will not come upon us, for we made falsehood our hope, and in falsehood we shall be protected”;

verses.text: therefore, thus says the Lord: “Behold, I lay for the foundations of Zion a costly stone, a chosen and precious cornerstone for its foundations, and whoever believes in Him will not be put to shame.
parts: therefore, thus says the Lord: “Behold, I lay for the foundations of Zion a costly stone, a chosen and precious cornerstone for its foundations, and whoever believes in Him will not be put to shame.

verses.text: I will also cause judgment to be for hope, and My mercy to be for a standard.
parts: I will also cause judgment to be for hope, and My mercy to be for a standard.

verses.text: except it also take away your covenant of death.
parts: except it also take away your covenant of death.

verses.text: When it passes through, it will take you; for morning by morning it will pass through by day, and by night there will be an evil hope.” Learn to listen,
parts: When it passes through, it will take you; for morning by morning it will pass through by day, and by night there will be an evil hope.” Learn to listen,

verses.text: you in difficult straits.
parts: you in difficult straits.

verses.text: As the mountain of the ungodly will rise up and be in the valley of Gibeon, He will do His deeds in anger, a work of bitterness.
parts: As the mountain of the ungodly will rise up and be in the valley of Gibeon, He will do His deeds in anger, a work of bitterness.

verses.text: So do not be glad, neither let your bands become strong; because I heard from the Lord of hosts the things He will perform upon all the earth.
parts: So do not be glad, neither let your bands become strong; because I heard from the Lord of hosts the things He will perform upon all the earth.

verses.text: Give ear and hear my voice.
parts: Give ear and hear my voice.

verses.text: Will the plowman plow all day?
parts: Will the plowman plow all day?

verses.text: When he levels its surface, does he not then sow the small black cummin, and afterward sow the wheat, the barley, and the one-seeded wheat in your borders?
parts: When he levels its surface, does he not then sow the small black cummin, and afterward sow the wheat, the barley, and the one-seeded wheat in your borders?

verses.text: So you will be chastised by the judgment of your God and be gladdened by it.
parts: So you will be chastised by the judgment of your God and be gladdened by it.

verses.text: For the black cummin is not cleansed with harshness, nor will the wheel of a wagon roll over the cummin; but the black cummin is threshed with a stick, and the cummin
parts: For the black cummin is not cleansed with harshness, nor will the wheel of a wagon roll over the cummin; but the black cummin is threshed with a stick, and the cummin

verses.text: will be eaten with bread.
parts: will be eaten with bread.

verses.text: These signs came forth from the Lord of hosts.
parts: These signs came forth from the Lord of hosts.

verses.text: For I will afflict Ariel, and her strength and wealth will be mine.
parts: For I will afflict Ariel, and her strength and wealth will be mine.

verses.text: I will encircle you as David did, and I will put a barricade around you, and place towers around you.
parts: I will encircle you as David did, and I will put a barricade around you, and place towers around you.

verses.text: Your words will be humbled to the earth, and your words will sink into the earth.
parts: Your words will be humbled to the earth, and your words will sink into the earth.

verses.text: Moreover the wealth of the ungodly shall be like the dust of a wheel and like dirt carried away.
parts: Moreover the wealth of the ungodly shall be like the dust of a wheel and like dirt carried away.

verses.text: from the Lord of hosts; for there will be a visitation with thunder and earthquake and a great noise, and a sudden blast of wind and a devouring flame of fire.
parts: from the Lord of hosts; for there will be a visitation with thunder and earthquake and a great noise, and a sudden blast of wind and a devouring flame of fire.

verses.text: The wealth of all the nations, as many as fought against Ariel, and all who wage war against Jerusalem, and all who gather against her and afflict her, shall be as one who dreams in the night.
parts: The wealth of all the nations, as many as fought against Ariel, and all who wage war against Jerusalem, and all who gather against her and afflict her, shall be as one who dreams in the night.

verses.text: They shall be like those who eat and drink in a dream, and when they awake their dream was useless, and as a thirsty man dreams, as if he is drinking but is still thirsty when he wakes, and his soul hoped in vain, so will be the wealth of all the nations that fought against Mount Zion.
parts: They shall be like those who eat and drink in a dream, and when they awake their dream was useless, and as a thirsty man dreams, as if he is drinking but is still thirsty when he wakes, and his soul hoped in vain, so will be the wealth of all the nations that fought against Mount Zion.

verses.text: Faint and be amazed; be overpowered, not with strong drink nor with wine,
parts: Faint and be amazed; be overpowered, not with strong drink nor with wine,

verses.text: for the Lord made you drink a spirit of deep sleep, and He shall close their eyes and the eyes of their prophets and rulers, who see secret things.
parts: for the Lord made you drink a spirit of deep sleep, and He shall close their eyes and the eyes of their prophets and rulers, who see secret things.

verses.text: All these things shall be to you as the words of this sealed book, which if they should give to a learned man, saying, “Read this,” then he will say, “I cannot read this, for it is sealed.”
parts: All these things shall be to you as the words of this sealed book, which if they should give to a learned man, saying, “Read this,” then he will say, “I cannot read this, for it is sealed.”

verses.text: This book shall also be placed in the hands of an unlearned man, and one shall say to him, “Read this,” then he will say, “I do not understand writings.”
parts: This book shall also be placed in the hands of an unlearned man, and one shall say to him, “Read this,” then he will say, “I do not understand writings.”

verses.text: So the Lord said, “These people draw near to Me and honor Me with their lips, but their heart is far from Me, and they worship Me in vain, teaching the commandments and doctrines of men.Therefore behold, I will proceed to remove this people, and I shall remove them. I shall destroy the wisdom of the wise and hide the understanding of the intelligent.” Woe to those who deepen their counsel, but not through the Lord! Woe to those who take counsel in secret and whose works are in darkness! They say, “Who sees us?” and, “Who knows us or what we do?”Shall you not be considered as the clay of the potter? Shall what is molded of clay say to him who molded it, “You did not create me”? Or shall the work say to him who made it, “You did not make me wisely”?Is it not yet a very little while until Lebanon shall be changed like Mount Carmel, and Mount Carmel be considered a forest?In that day, the deaf shall hear the words of the book, and the eyes of those in darkness and in a fog shall see.The poor also shall rejoice exceedingly in gladness because of the Lord, and the hopeless among men shall be filled with gladness.The lawless man has come to an end, and the arrogant man has perished. Those who act lawlessly in malice are utterly destroyed, as well as those who cause men to sin in word. They shall make all who condemn at the gates an offense, because they turned aside the righteous man with wrongdoing.Therefore the Lord says this concerning the house of Jacob, whom He set apart out of Abraham: “Now Jacob shall not be ashamed, nor shall Israel now change his countenance.But when their children see My works, they shall sanctify My name for My sake, and will sanctify the Holy One of Jacob, and fear the God of Israel.And those who erred in spirit shall know understanding, and those who complained will learn to obey, and the stammering tongues shall learn to speak peace.”
parts: So the Lord said, “These people draw near to Me and honor Me with their lips, but their heart is far from Me, and they worship Me in vain, teaching the commandments and doctrines of men.

Therefore behold, I will proceed to remove this people, and I shall remove them. I shall destroy the wisdom of the wise and hide the understanding of the intelligent.” Woe to those who deepen their counsel, but not through the Lord! Woe to those who take counsel in secret and whose works are in darkness! They say, “Who sees us?” and, “Who knows us or what we do?”

Shall you not be considered as the clay of the potter? Shall what is molded of clay say to him who molded it, “You did not create me”? Or shall the work say to him who made it, “You did not make me wisely”?Is it not yet a very little while until Lebanon shall be changed like Mount Carmel, and Mount Carmel be considered a forest?In that day, the deaf shall hear the words of the book, and the eyes of those in darkness and in a fog shall see.The poor also shall rejoice exceedingly in gladness because of the Lord, and the hopeless among men shall be filled with gladness.The lawless man has come to an end, and the arrogant man has perished. Those who act lawlessly in malice are utterly destroyed, as well as those who cause men to sin in word. They shall make all who condemn at the gates an offense, because they turned aside the righteous man with wrongdoing.Therefore the Lord says this concerning the house of Jacob, whom He set apart out of Abraham: “Now Jacob shall not be ashamed, nor shall Israel now change his countenance.But when their children see My works, they shall sanctify My name for My sake, and will sanctify the Holy One of Jacob, and fear the God of Israel.
And those who erred in spirit shall know understanding, and those who complained will learn to obey, and the stammering tongues shall learn to speak peace.”

verses.text: Therefore behold, I will proceed to remove this people, and I shall remove them.
parts: Therefore behold, I will proceed to remove this people, and I shall remove them.

verses.text: Woe to those who deepen their counsel, but not through the Lord!
parts: Woe to those who deepen their counsel, but not through the Lord!

verses.text: Shall you not be considered as the clay of the potter?
parts: Shall you not be considered as the clay of the potter?

verses.text: Is it not yet a very little while until Lebanon shall be changed like Mount Carmel, and Mount Carmel be considered a forest?
parts: Is it not yet a very little while until Lebanon shall be changed like Mount Carmel, and Mount Carmel be considered a forest?

verses.text: In that day, the deaf shall hear the words of the book, and the eyes of those in darkness and in a fog shall see.
parts: In that day, the deaf shall hear the words of the book, and the eyes of those in darkness and in a fog shall see.

verses.text: The poor also shall rejoice exceedingly in gladness because of the Lord, and the hopeless among men shall be filled with gladness.
parts: The poor also shall rejoice exceedingly in gladness because of the Lord, and the hopeless among men shall be filled with gladness.

verses.text: The lawless man has come to an end, and the arrogant man has perished.
parts: The lawless man has come to an end, and the arrogant man has perished.

verses.text: as well as those who cause men to sin in word.
parts: as well as those who cause men to sin in word.

verses.text: Therefore the Lord says this concerning the house of Jacob, whom He set apart out of Abraham: “Now Jacob shall not be ashamed, nor shall Israel now change his countenance.

verses.text: But when their children see My works, they shall sanctify My name for My sake, and will sanctify the Holy One of Jacob, and fear the God of Israel.

verses.text: And those who erred in spirit shall know understanding, and those who complained will learn to obey, and the stammering tongues shall learn to speak peace.”
parts: And those who erred in spirit shall know understanding, and those who complained will learn to obey, and the stammering tongues shall learn to speak peace.”

verses.text: You proceeded to go down to Egypt, but did not ask Me, so as to be helped by Pharaoh and protected by the Egyptians.
parts: You proceeded to go down to Egypt, but did not ask Me, so as to be helped by Pharaoh and protected by the Egyptians.

verses.text: For the protection of Pharaoh shall be your shame, and there shall be disgrace for those who trust in Egypt.
parts: For the protection of Pharaoh shall be your shame, and there shall be disgrace for those who trust in Egypt.

verses.text: For there are rulers at Tanis, evil messengers.
parts: For there are rulers at Tanis, evil messengers.

verses.text: in seeking a people who will not profit, help or benefit them, but they shall be for them a shame and a disgrace.”
parts: in seeking a people who will not profit, help or benefit them, but they shall be for them a shame and a disgrace.”

verses.text: The vision of the quadrupeds in the desert:
parts: The vision of the quadrupeds in the desert:

verses.text: For the Egyptians shall help you utterly in vain.
parts: For the Egyptians shall help you utterly in vain.

verses.text: Now therefore, sit and write these things on a tablet in a book, for these things shall be for the time to come, even forever.For this is a disobedient people, false children, children who are unwilling to hear the law of God.They say to the prophets, “Do not report to us”; and to those who see visions, “Do not speak to us, but speak and declare to us another deception.Turn us aside from this way; remove this path from us, and take away from us the Holy One of Israel.” Therefore thus says the Lord, the Holy One of Israel: “Because you disobeyed these words, and hoped in falsehood and grumbled and were confident in this respect; therefore, this sin shall be to you like a wall ready to fall when a strong city is taken, whose fall is immediately present.Its fall shall be like the breaking of a clay vessel, like that of a small jar, so as not to find among them even a fragment with which to take away fire, or draw a little water.” For thus says the Lord, the Holy One of Israel: “When you return and groan, then you will be saved and know where you were. When you trusted in vain things, vain was your strength, and you did not will to listen.”But you said, “We will flee on horses”—therefore you shall flee. You also said, “We will ride on swift horses”—therefore those who pursue you shall be swift.One thousand shall flee at the voice of one; at the voice of five, many shall flee, until you are left as a pole upon a mountain, and as one holding a banner on a hill.And again God will wait, that He may have compassion on you; and therefore He will be exalted, that He may have mercy on you, because the Lord our God is a judge, and where will you leave behind your glory? Blessed are all those who abide in Him.

They say to the prophets, “Do not report to us”; and to those who see visions, “Do not speak to us, but speak and declare to us another deception.Turn us aside from this way; remove this path from us, and take away from us the Holy One of Israel.” Therefore thus says the Lord, the Holy One of Israel: “Because you disobeyed these words, and hoped in falsehood and grumbled and were confident in this respect; therefore, this sin shall be to you like a wall ready to fall when a strong city is taken, whose fall is immediately present.Its fall shall be like the breaking of a clay vessel, like that of a small jar, so as not to find among them even a fragment with which to take away fire, or draw a little water.” For thus says the Lord, the Holy One of Israel: “When you return and groan, then you will be saved and know where you were. When you trusted in vain things, vain was your strength, and you did not will to listen.”

Blessed are all those who abide in Him.

verses.text: And again God will wait, that He may have compassion on you; and therefore He will be exalted, that He may have mercy on you, because the Lord our God is a judge, and where will you leave behind your glory?
parts: And again God will wait, that He may have compassion on you; and therefore He will be exalted, that He may have mercy on you, because the Lord our God is a judge, and where will you leave behind your glory?

verses.text: For a holy people shall dwell in Zion; and Jerusalem cried with wailing, “Have mercy on me.” He will have mercy on you at the sound of your cry. When He sees this, He will listen to you.The Lord will give you the bread of affliction and scant water; and those leading you astray will no longer approach you, but your eyes shall see those leading you astray.Your ears shall hear words behind you leading you astray, saying, “This is the way; let us walk in it,” either to the right hand or to the left.You will also remove your idols plaited with silver and covered with gold. You will grind them to powder and scatter them like the water of an indisposed woman, and thrust them away like dung.Then there will be rain for the seed of your land, and the bread of produce of your land's increase will be plenteous and rich. In that day your cattle will feed in rich and large pastures.Your bulls and the oxen that work the ground will eat straw prepared with winnowed barley.On every high mountain and on every high hill there will be streams in that day, when many perish and the towers fall.In that day, the light of the moon will be as the light of the sun, and the light of the sun will be sevenfold, when the Lord heals the wound of His people and the pain of your plague.
parts: For a holy people shall dwell in Zion; and Jerusalem cried with wailing, “Have mercy on me.” He will have mercy on you at the sound of your cry. When He sees this, He will listen to you.The Lord will give you the bread of affliction and scant water; and those leading you astray will no longer approach you, but your eyes shall see those leading you astray.

Your ears shall hear words behind you leading you astray, saying, “This is the way; let us walk in it,” either to the right hand or to the left.You will also remove your idols plaited with silver and covered with gold. verses.text: Behold, the name of the Lord comes after a long time, a burning anger. The teaching of His lips is with glory, a revelation full of wrath, and the wrath of His anger shall devour like fire.His breath, like an overflowing stream in a valley, shall reach up to the neck and be divided, to trouble the nations for their vain error; and error shall pursue and overtake them.Must you always be glad, and go into My holy places continually, as those who keep a feast, and must you always go with a flute, as those who are glad when they go into the mountain of the Lord, to the God of Israel?God will cause His glorious voice to be heard, and He will show the anger of His arm with anger and wrath, and the flame of a devouring fire. He shall strike violently with thunderbolts, and His wrath shall be as water and violent hail.For through the voice of the Lord, the Assyrians will be defeated, as He strikes them with the rod.And it shall happen to him on every side, that those from whom his hope of assistance was, and in whom he trusted, shall themselves, in turn, make war on him with flutes and harps.For you will be required before many days: Was it prepared for you also to reign? No, God prepared for you a deep valley, wood laid down, fire and much wood. The anger of the Lord shall be as a valley burning with brimstone.

The teaching of His lips is with glory, a revelation full of wrath, and the wrath of His anger shall devour like fire.His breath, like an overflowing stream in a valley, shall reach up to the neck and be divided, to trouble the nations for their vain error; and error shall pursue and overtake them.Must you always be glad, and go into My holy places continually, as those who keep a feast, and must you always go with a flute, as those who are glad when they go into the mountain of the Lord, to the God of Israel?God will cause His glorious voice to be heard, and He will show the anger of His arm with anger and wrath, and the flame of a devouring fire. No, God prepared for you a deep valley, wood laid down, fire and much wood. The anger of the Lord shall be as a valley burning with brimstone.

parts: For you will be required before many days: Was it prepared for you also to reign?

verses.text: So He wisely brings evils upon them, and His word cannot be set aside, for He will rise up against the houses of evil men and against their vain hope.
parts: So He wisely brings evils upon them, and His word cannot be set aside, for He will rise up against the houses of evil men and against their vain hope.

verses.text: Now an Egyptian is a man, and not God; and their horses are flesh, and not a help.
parts: Now an Egyptian is a man, and not God; and their horses are flesh, and not a help.

verses.text: For thus the Lord said to me: “As a lion roars, and a young lion over his prey, which he took and cries out upon it until the mountains are filled with his sound, and the animals are awestruck and terrified at the fierceness of his anger, so the Lord of hosts will come down to fight for Mount Zion, even upon her mountains.
parts: For thus the Lord said to me: “As a lion roars, and a young lion over his prey, which he took and cries out upon it until the mountains are filled with his sound, and the animals are awestruck and terrified at the fierceness of his anger, so the Lord of hosts will come down to fight for Mount Zion, even upon her mountains.

verses.text: Like birds flying about, so will the Lord defend Jerusalem.
parts: Like birds flying about, so will the Lord defend Jerusalem.

verses.text: Return, you who planned a deep and lawless counsel.
parts: Return, you who planned a deep and lawless counsel.

verses.text: For in that day, men shall renounce their idols of silver and gold, which their hands made.
parts: For in that day, men shall renounce their idols of silver and gold, which their hands made.

verses.text: Then the Assyrian shall fall by a sword not of man, and a sword not of man shall devour him.
parts: Then the Assyrian shall fall by a sword not of man, and a sword not of man shall devour him.

verses.text: For they shall be surrounded by a rock as by a barricade, and he who flees shall be caught.
parts: For they shall be surrounded by a rock as by a barricade, and he who flees shall be caught.

verses.text: A Man will hide His words, and be hidden as from flowing water; and He will appear in Zion as a glorious river flowing in a thirsty land.
parts: A Man will hide His words, and be hidden as from flowing water; and He will appear in Zion as a glorious river flowing in a thirsty land.

verses.text: And they will no longer trust in men, but their ears will incline to listen.
parts: And they will no longer trust in men, but their ears will incline to listen.

verses.text: The heart of the sick will pay attention to listen, and the tongues that stammer will learn quickly to speak peace.”
parts: The heart of the sick will pay attention to listen, and the tongues that stammer will learn quickly to speak peace.”

verses.text: Let them no longer tell a fool to rule, nor let Your servants say any longer, “Be silent.”
parts: Let them no longer tell a fool to rule, nor let Your servants say any longer, “Be silent.”

verses.text: For the fool will speak foolishness, and his heart will think vain things: to practice lawlessness, to speak error against the Lord, to scatter hungry souls, and to make thirsty souls empty.
parts: For the fool will speak foolishness, and his heart will think vain things: to practice lawlessness, to speak error against the Lord, to scatter hungry souls, and to make thirsty souls empty.

verses.text: For the counsel of evil men plans lawlessness, to destroy the humble with unjust words, and to scatter the words of the humble with judgment.
parts: For the counsel of evil men plans lawlessness, to destroy the humble with unjust words, and to scatter the words of the humble with judgment.

verses.text: But the godly plan wise things, and this counsel remains.
parts: But the godly plan wise things, and this counsel remains.

verses.text: Rise up, you rich women, and hear my voice. You daughters with hope, listen to my words.In pain, yet with hope, remember that for a full year the harvest will be consumed and cease. It shall by no means come again.Be amazed, be grieved, you confident ones. Strip yourselves, and gird your loins with sackcloth.Beat upon your breasts because of the desirable fields and the fruit of the vine.On the land of my people, thorns and grass will come up, and gladness will be taken from every house. As for the rich city, the houses are deserted, and they will leave behind the wealth of the city and desirable houses. The villages will become caves forever, and the gladness of wild donkeys and pastures of shepherds— until the Spirit comes upon you from on high, and the desert becomes a fruitful field, and the fruitful field is counted as a forest.Then judgment will take rest in the desert, and righteousness shall dwell in Carmel.The works of righteousness will be peace, and righteousness shall ensure rest and confidence forever.His people will dwell in a city of peace, and will dwell in confidence, and they will rest with riches.Though hail should come down, it would not fall upon you, and those who dwell in the forests shall be as confident as those in the plain.Blessed are those who sow beside all waters, where the ox and the donkey tread.

It shall by no means come again.Be amazed, be grieved, you confident ones. Strip yourselves, and gird your loins with sackcloth.Beat upon your breasts because of the desirable fields and the fruit of the vine.On the land of my people, thorns and grass will come up, and gladness will be taken from every house. Then judgment will take rest in the desert, and righteousness shall dwell in Carmel.The works of righteousness will be peace, and righteousness shall ensure rest and confidence forever.His people will dwell in a city of peace, and will dwell in confidence, and they will rest with riches.Though hail should come down, it would not fall upon you, and those who dwell in the forests shall be as confident as those in the plain.Blessed are those who sow beside all waters, where the ox and the donkey tread.

verses.text: Then judgment will take rest in the desert, and righteousness shall dwell in Carmel.
parts: Then judgment will take rest in the desert, and righteousness shall dwell in Carmel.

verses.text: The works of righteousness will be peace, and righteousness shall ensure rest and confidence forever.
parts: The works of righteousness will be peace, and righteousness shall ensure rest and confidence forever.

verses.text: His people will dwell in a city of peace, and will dwell in confidence, and they will rest with riches.
parts: His people will dwell in a city of peace, and will dwell in confidence, and they will rest with riches.

verses.text: Though hail should come down, it would not fall upon you, and those who dwell in the forests shall be as confident as those in the plain.
parts: Though hail should come down, it would not fall upon you, and those who dwell in the forests shall be as confident as those in the plain.

verses.text: Blessed are those who sow beside all waters, where the ox and the donkey tread.
parts: Blessed are those who sow beside all waters, where the ox and the donkey tread.

verses.text: O Lord, have mercy on us; for we trust in You.
parts: O Lord, have mercy on us; for we trust in You.

verses.text: The peoples were dismayed through fear of You, because of Your fearsome voice, and the nations were scattered.
parts: The peoples were dismayed through fear of You, because of Your fearsome voice, and the nations were scattered.

verses.text: So now the spoils of your small and great shall be gathered, as if someone might gather grasshoppers.
parts: So now the spoils of your small and great shall be gathered, as if someone might gather grasshoppers.

verses.text: The God who dwells in the heights is holy.
parts: The God who dwells in the heights is holy.

verses.text: They will be handed over to the law.
parts: They will be handed over to the law.

verses.text: Behold therefore, they will fear you greatly, and those you feared will fear you.
parts: Behold therefore, they will fear you greatly, and those you feared will fear you.

verses.text: For their ways will lie desolate.
parts: For their ways will lie desolate.

verses.text: The earth mourns, and Lebanon is shamed.
parts: The earth mourns, and Lebanon is shamed.

verses.text: “Now I will arise,” says the Lord; “now I will be glorified; now I will be exalted.
parts: “Now I will arise,” says the Lord; “now I will be glorified; now I will be exalted.

verses.text: Now you shall see, now you shall perceive; the strength of your spirit is vain; fire shall devour you.
parts: Now you shall see, now you shall perceive; the strength of your spirit is vain; fire shall devour you.

verses.text: The nations shall be burned up, like thorns thrown in the field and burned up.
parts: The nations shall be burned up, like thorns thrown in the field and burned up.

verses.text: Those afar off will hear what I have done; and those near will know My strength.”
parts: Those afar off will hear what I have done; and those near will know My strength.”

verses.text: The lawless in Zion departed; trembling will seize the ungodly.
parts: The lawless in Zion departed; trembling will seize the ungodly.

verses.text: He who walks in righteousness and speaks uprightly, he who hates lawlessness and wrongdoing, who gestures with his hands, refusing bribes, he who stops his ears from hearing the judgment of blood, and he who shuts his eyes from seeing wrongdoing.
parts: He who walks in righteousness and speaks uprightly, he who hates lawlessness and wrongdoing, who gestures with his hands, refusing bribes, he who stops his ears from hearing the judgment of blood, and he who shuts his eyes from seeing wrongdoing.

verses.text: He will dwell in a high cave of a mighty rock.
parts: He will dwell in a high cave of a mighty rock.

verses.text: All of you will see a King with His glory, and your eyes will see a land from afar.
parts: All of you will see a King with His glory, and your eyes will see a land from afar.

verses.text: Your soul will think about fear.
parts: Your soul will think about fear.

verses.text: both a small and great people, with whom they did not consult, nor did he know a deep-voiced people, that a despised people should not hear, and there is no understanding to him who hears?
parts: both a small and great people, with whom they did not consult, nor did he know a deep-voiced people, that a despised people should not hear, and there is no understanding to him who hears?

verses.text: Behold, there is Zion, the city of our salvation.
parts: Behold, there is Zion, the city of our salvation.

verses.text: for the name of the Lord is great to you.
parts: for the name of the Lord is great to you.

verses.text: For my God is great.
parts: For my God is great.

verses.text: Your ropes broke apart, for the boat was not strong.
parts: Your ropes broke apart, for the boat was not strong.

verses.text: And the people who dwell among them will not say, “I am weary,” for their sin shall be forgiven.
parts: And the people who dwell among them will not say, “I am weary,” for their sin shall be forgiven.

verses.text: For the anger of the Lord is against all the nations, and His wrath against all the number of them, to destroy them utterly and to deliver them over for slaughter.
parts: For the anger of the Lord is against all the nations, and His wrath against all the number of them, to destroy them utterly and to deliver them over for slaughter.

verses.text: Their slain and their dead shall be thrown out; their stench shall rise from their dead bodies, and the mountains shall be drenched with their blood.
parts: Their slain and their dead shall be thrown out; their stench shall rise from their dead bodies, and the mountains shall be drenched with their blood.

verses.text: Heaven shall also be rolled up like a scroll, and all the stars shall fall like leaves from a vine, as leaves fall from a fig tree.
parts: Heaven shall also be rolled up like a scroll, and all the stars shall fall like leaves from a vine, as leaves fall from a fig tree.

verses.text: My sword in heaven is soaked with blood.
parts: My sword in heaven is soaked with blood.

verses.text: The sword of the Lord is filled with blood.
parts: The sword of the Lord is filled with blood.

verses.text: The mighty ones shall fall with them, and the rams and the bulls.
parts: The mighty ones shall fall with them, and the rams and the bulls.

verses.text: For it is the day of the Lord's judgment and the year of recompense for the cause of Zion.
parts: For it is the day of the Lord's judgment and the year of recompense for the cause of Zion.

verses.text: Its valleys shall be turned into pitch and its land into brimstone.
parts: Its valleys shall be turned into pitch and its land into brimstone.

verses.text: It shall never be quenched day or night, and its smoke shall rise up.
parts: It shall never be quenched day or night, and its smoke shall rise up.

verses.text: But birds and hedgehogs shall live in it, and also ibises and ravens.
parts: But birds and hedgehogs shall live in it, and also ibises and ravens.

verses.text: Its rulers shall be no more, for its kings, rulers, and great ones shall be destroyed.
parts: Its rulers shall be no more, for its kings, rulers, and great ones shall be destroyed.

verses.text: Thorn-trees shall come up in its cities and fortresses; it shall be a habitation of sirens, a courtyard for ostriches.
parts: Thorn-trees shall come up in its cities and fortresses; it shall be a habitation of sirens, a courtyard for ostriches.

verses.text: Demons shall also meet with donkey-centaurs, and one will cry out to another.
parts: Demons shall also meet with donkey-centaurs, and one will cry out to another.

verses.text: There the hedgehog made its nest, and the earth preserved its children in safety.
parts: There the hedgehog made its nest, and the earth preserved its children in safety.

verses.text: They passed by in numbers, and not one of them perished.
parts: They passed by in numbers, and not one of them perished.

verses.text: He shall cast lots for them, and His hand divided it among them to graze upon.
parts: He shall cast lots for them, and His hand divided it among them to graze upon.

verses.text: The desert places of the Jordan shall blossom abundantly and rejoice exceedingly.
parts: The desert places of the Jordan shall blossom abundantly and rejoice exceedingly.

verses.text: Be strong, you relaxed hands and feeble knees.
parts: Be strong, you relaxed hands and feeble knees.

verses.text: Be comforted, you fainthearted.
parts: Be comforted, you fainthearted.

verses.text: Then the eyes of the blind shall be opened, and the ears of the deaf shall hear.
parts: Then the eyes of the blind shall be opened, and the ears of the deaf shall hear.

verses.text: Then the lame shall leap like a deer, and the tongue of the dumb will speak clearly.
parts: Then the lame shall leap like a deer, and the tongue of the dumb will speak clearly.

verses.text: The waterless desert shall become meadows, and the thirsty land springs of water.
parts: The waterless desert shall become meadows, and the thirsty land springs of water.

verses.text: A pure way shall be there, and it shall be called a holy way.
parts: A pure way shall be there, and it shall be called a holy way.

verses.text: No lion shall be there, nor shall any ravenous animals go up on it, nor at all be found there.
parts: No lion shall be there, nor shall any ravenous animals go up on it, nor at all be found there.

verses.text: and those gathered by the Lord shall return and come to Zion with gladness, and with everlasting gladness over their head.
parts: and those gathered by the Lord shall return and come to Zion with gladness, and with everlasting gladness over their head.

verses.text: Then the king of the Assyrians sent Rabshakeh with a great army from Lachish to King Hezekiah at Jerusalem, and he stood by the aqueduct of the upper pool, on the way of the fuller's field.
parts: Then the king of the Assyrians sent Rabshakeh with a great army from Lachish to King Hezekiah at Jerusalem, and he stood by the aqueduct of the upper pool, on the way of the fuller's field.

verses.text: So Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, the steward, Shebna the scribe, and Joah the son of Asaph, the recorder, came out to him.
parts: So Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, the steward, Shebna the scribe, and Joah the son of Asaph, the recorder, came out to him.

verses.text: Then the Rabshakeh said to them, “Say now to Hezekiah, ‘Thus says the great king, the king of the Assyrians: “Why are you confident?
parts: Then the Rabshakeh said to them, “Say now to Hezekiah, ‘Thus says the great king, the king of the Assyrians: “Why are you confident?

verses.text: Is a war carried on by counsel or mere words?
parts: Is a war carried on by counsel or mere words?

verses.text: Behold, you are trusting in the staff of this broken reed, Egypt, on which if a man leans, it will puncture his hand.
parts: Behold, you are trusting in the staff of this broken reed, Egypt, on which if a man leans, it will puncture his hand.

verses.text: But will you say, ‘We trust in the Lord our God’?’ ”
parts: But will you say, ‘We trust in the Lord our God’?’ ”

verses.text: Now therefore, make an agreement with my lord the king of the Assyrians, and I will give you two thousand horses—if you are able on your part to put riders on them.
parts: Now therefore, make an agreement with my lord the king of the Assyrians, and I will give you two thousand horses—if you are able on your part to put riders on them.

verses.text: How are you able to turn back the face of one governor?
parts: How are you able to turn back the face of one governor?

verses.text: Have we now come up without the Lord to make war against this country?”
parts: Have we now come up without the Lord to make war against this country?”

verses.text: Then Eliakim, Shebna, and Joah said to the Rabshakeh, “Speak to your servants in the Syrian language, for we understand it; and do not speak to us in Hebrew in the hearing of the men who are on the wall.” But Rabshakeh said to them, “Has my lord sent me to your lord or to you to speak these words? Has he not sent me to speak to the men who sit on the wall, so they may eat their own dung, and drink their own urine with you?” Then the Rabshakeh stood and called out with a loud voice in Hebrew, and said, “Hear the words of the great king, the king of the Assyrians.Thus says the king: ‘Do not let Hezekiah deceive you with words which will be unable to deliver you; nor let Hezekiah say to you, “God will deliver you, and this city will not be given into the hand of the king of the Assyrians.’ ” Do not listen to Hezekiah; for thus says the king of Assyria: ‘If you wish to be blessed, come out to me, and each of you will eat from his own vine and his own fig tree, and all of you will drink the waters of your own cistern, until I come and take you away to a land like your own land, a land of grain and wine, and of bread and vineyards.’ Let not Hezekiah deceive you, saying, ‘God will deliver us.’ Has any one of the gods of the nations delivered its land from the hand of the king of the Assyrians?Where are the gods of Hamath and Arpad? Where are the gods of Sepharvaim? Have they delivered Samaria from my hand?Who among all the gods of these nations delivered his land from my hand, that God should deliver Jerusalem from my hand?” But they held their peace and answered him not a word, because of the king's commandment not to answer him.

verses.text: Then Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, the steward, Shebna the scribe of the army, and Joah the son of Asaph, the recorder, came to Hezekiah with their clothes torn and told him the words of the Rabshakeh.
parts: Then Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, the steward, Shebna the scribe of the army, and Joah the son of Asaph, the recorder, came to Hezekiah with their clothes torn and told him the words of the Rabshakeh.

verses.text: Then he sent Eliakim the steward, Shebna the scribe, and the elders of the priests, covered with sackcloth, to Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz.
parts: Then he sent Eliakim the steward, Shebna the scribe, and the elders of the priests, covered with sackcloth, to Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz.

verses.text: So they said to him, “Thus says Hezekiah: ‘This day is a day of affliction, disgrace, rebuke, and wrath; for the pangs of childbirth have come, but there is no strength to give birth.
parts: So they said to him, “Thus says Hezekiah: ‘This day is a day of affliction, disgrace, rebuke, and wrath; for the pangs of childbirth have come, but there is no strength to give birth.

verses.text: May the Lord your God hear the words of the Rabshakeh, whom the king of the Assyrians sent to denounce the living God, and to insult Him with words which the Lord your God heard.
parts: May the Lord your God hear the words of the Rabshakeh, whom the king of the Assyrians sent to denounce the living God, and to insult Him with words which the Lord your God heard.

verses.text: So the servants of King Hezekiah came to Isaiah,
parts: So the servants of King Hezekiah came to Isaiah,

verses.text: and Isaiah said to them, “Thus shall you say to your lord: ‘The Lord says this, “Do not be afraid of the words you heard, whereby the ambassadors of the king of the Assyrians denounced Me.
parts: and Isaiah said to them, “Thus shall you say to your lord: ‘The Lord says this, “Do not be afraid of the words you heard, whereby the ambassadors of the king of the Assyrians denounced Me.

verses.text: Behold, I will send a spirit upon him, and he shall hear a rumor and return to his land.
parts: Behold, I will send a spirit upon him, and he shall hear a rumor and return to his land.

verses.text: So Rabshakeh returned and found the king warring against Libnah. Then the king of the Assyrians heard thatTirhakah king of the Ethiopians had come out to make war against him. So when he heard it, he returned and sent messengers to Hezekiah, saying, “Thus you shall speak to Hezekiah king of Judah, saying, ‘Do not let your God in whom you trust deceive you, saying, “Jerusalem shall not be given into the hand of the king of the Assyrians.”You heard what the kings of the Assyrians did to all lands by destroying them.Did the gods of the nations deliver those my fathers destroyed—Gozan and Haran and Rezeph in the country of Telassar?Where are the kings of Hamath and Arpad, and the kings of the city of Sepharvaim, Hena, and Ivah?’ ” So Hezekiah received the scroll from the messengers and opened it before the Lord.Then Hezekiah prayed to the Lord, saying, “O Lord of hosts, the God of Israel, the One who sits between the cherubim, You alone are the God of all the kingdoms of the world. You made heaven and earth.Hear, O Lord, and open Your eyes, O Lord, and see the words Sennacherib sent to denounce the living God.For it is true, the kings of the Assyrians laid waste the inhabited earth and their countries, and cast their idols into the fire; for they were not gods, but works of men's hands—wood and stone. Therefore they destroyed them.But now, O Lord our God, save us from their hand, that all the kingdoms of the earth may know You alone are God.”

verses.text: Then Isaiah the son of Amoz sent to Hezekiah and said to him, “The Lord God of Israel says this: ‘I heard what you prayed to Me against Sennacherib king of the Assyrians.This is the word God has spoken concerning him: “The virgin daughter of Zion has despised and laughed you to scorn. The daughter of Jerusalem has shaken her head at you.Whom have you denounced and provoked? Or against whom have you raised your voice? You have lifted your eyes on high against the Holy One of Israel.By your messengers, you have insulted the Lord, for you said, ‘By the multitude of my chariots I came to the height of the mountains, to the limits of Lebanon. I cut down its tall cedars and its choice cypress trees, and entered the height of its forest region.I built a bridge, and dried up the waters and every pool of water.’ Did you not hear long ago the things I did? From ancient times I appointed them, but now have manifested my purpose to desolate nations in their strongholds and those who dwell in strong cities.I weakened their hands, and they withered; and they became like dry grass on the housetops and like weeds.Now then, I know your resting place, your going out and your coming in.Your great rage and bitterness has come up to Me. Therefore I will put a hook in your nose and a bridle in your lips, and I will turn you back by the way you came.’ ” This shall be a sign to you: You shall eat this year what you sowed, and the second year what is left over; also in the third year sow and reap; plant vineyards and eat the fruit of them.So the remnant in the house of Judah shall again take root downward and bear fruit upward.For out of Jerusalem a remnant shall go forth, and those saved from Mount Zion. The zeal of the Lord of hosts will perform these things.Therefore, thus says the Lord concerning the king of the Assyrians: ‘He shall not come into this city, nor shoot an arrow there, nor come before it with shield, nor build a siege mound against it.By the way he came, by the same shall he return,’ says the Lord.‘I will protect this city, to save it for My own sake and for My servant David's sake.’ ”

verses.text: Then the Angel of the Lord went out and killed in the camp of the Assyrians one hundred and eighty-five thousand; and when people arose early in the morning, they discovered all the dead bodies.Then Sennacherib king of the Assyrians departed and returned to Nineveh, and dwelt there.Now it came to pass, as he was worshiping in the house of Nisroch his god, his sons Adrammelech and Sharezer struck him down with the sword, then escaped into the land of Ararat; and Esarhaddon his son reigned in his place.

verses.text: Then Hezekiah turned his face toward the wall, and prayed to the Lord,
parts: Then Hezekiah turned his face toward the wall, and prayed to the Lord,

verses.text: and said, “Remember now, O Lord, I pray, how I have walked before You in truth and with a true heart, and did what is pleasing in Your sight.” So Hezekiah wept loudly.
parts: and said, “Remember now, O Lord, I pray, how I have walked before You in truth and with a true heart, and did what is pleasing in Your sight.” So Hezekiah wept loudly.

verses.text: Then the word of the Lord came to Isaiah, saying,
parts: Then the word of the Lord came to Isaiah, saying,

verses.text: “Go and tell Hezekiah, ‘Thus says the Lord, the God of David your father: “I heard your prayer, I see your tears.
parts: “Go and tell Hezekiah, ‘Thus says the Lord, the God of David your father: “I heard your prayer, I see your tears.

verses.text: I will deliver you and this city from the hand of the king of the Assyrians, and I will protect this city.
parts: I will deliver you and this city from the hand of the king of the Assyrians, and I will protect this city.

verses.text: Now this shall be the sign to you from the Lord, that God will do this thing:
parts: Now this shall be the sign to you from the Lord, that God will do this thing:

verses.text: I will turn back the shadow on the ten steps of your father's house—the steps on which the sun goes down.” ’ ” So the sun's shadow that went down on the ten steps turned back.
parts: I will turn back the shadow on the ten steps of your father's house—the steps on which the sun goes down.” ’ ” So the sun's shadow that went down on the ten steps turned back.

verses.text: The prayer of Hezekiah king of Judah when he was sick and recovered from his sickness: “I said at the end of my days near the gates of Hades, ‘I shall leave behind the remainder of my years.’ I said, ‘I shall no longer see the salvation of my God upon the earth; I shall no longer see a man among my kindred.’ I left behind what remained of my life. It went away and departed from me like one who takes down a tent. My breath became in me like the web of a weaver when she draws near to cut it.On that day I was given as to a lion until morning. So He broke my bones, for from day until night I was given over.Like a swallow, so shall I cry; I will mourn like a dove. My eyes fail from looking to the height of heaven toward the Lord, who delivered me and removed the pain of my soul.O Lord, it was told You concerning this, and You revived my breath; and I was comforted and lived.For You chose my soul that it should not perish, and You cast all my sins behind me.For those in Hades shall not praise You, neither will the dead bless You; nor shall those in Hades hope for Your mercy.The living shall praise You as I do. For from this day forward, I shall cause children to declare Your righteousness, O Lord of my salvation, and I shall not cease to bless You with the psaltery all the days of my life before the house of God.”

verses.text: Now Isaiah said to Hezekiah, “Take a cake of figs, mash them, and apply them as a plaster, and you shall recover.” Then Hezekiah said, “This is the sign that I shall go up to the house of the Lord God.”
parts: Now Isaiah said to Hezekiah, “Take a cake of figs, mash them, and apply them as a plaster, and you shall recover.” Then Hezekiah said, “This is the sign that I shall go up to the house of the Lord God.”

verses.text: Then Hezekiah said, “This is the sign that I shall go up to the house of the Lord God.”
parts: Then Hezekiah said, “This is the sign that I shall go up to the house of the Lord God.”

verses.text: Hezekiah was very glad they came, and he showed them the house of his treasures—the oil of myrrh, the fragrant incense, the ointment, the silver and the gold—and all the treasure houses with their vessels, and everything found among his treasures.
parts: Hezekiah was very glad they came, and he showed them the house of his treasures—the oil of myrrh, the fragrant incense, the ointment, the silver and the gold—and all the treasure houses with their vessels, and everything found among his treasures.

verses.text: Then Isaiah the prophet went to King Hezekiah, and said to him, “What did these men say, and from where did they come to you?” So Hezekiah said, “They came to me from a far country, from Babylon.”
parts: Then Isaiah the prophet went to King Hezekiah, and said to him, “What did these men say, and from where did they come to you?” So Hezekiah said, “They came to me from a far country, from Babylon.”

verses.text: Then he said, “What did they see in your house?” So Hezekiah answered, “They saw everything in my house; there is nothing in my house they did not see, even among my treasures.”
parts: Then he said, “What did they see in your house?” So Hezekiah answered, “They saw everything in my house; there is nothing in my house they did not see, even among my treasures.”

verses.text: Then Isaiah said to Hezekiah, “Hear the word of the Lord of hosts:
parts: Then Isaiah said to Hezekiah, “Hear the word of the Lord of hosts:

verses.text: ‘Behold, the days are coming,’ says the Lord, ‘when everything in your house and everything your fathers accumulated until this day shall be carried to Babylon; nothing shall be left.’
parts: ‘Behold, the days are coming,’ says the Lord, ‘when everything in your house and everything your fathers accumulated until this day shall be carried to Babylon; nothing shall be left.’

verses.text: God also said they shall take away some of your sons whom you begot, and make them eunuchs in the palace of the king of Babylon.”
parts: God also said they shall take away some of your sons whom you begot, and make them eunuchs in the palace of the king of Babylon.”

verses.text: So Hezekiah said to Isaiah, “The Lord's word you spoke is good.
parts: So Hezekiah said to Isaiah, “The Lord's word you spoke is good.

verses.text: “O priests, speak to the heart of Jerusalem, comfort her, for her humiliation is ended, her sin is pardoned; for she received from the Lord's hand double for her sins.”
parts: “O priests, speak to the heart of Jerusalem, comfort her, for her humiliation is ended, her sin is pardoned; for she received from the Lord's hand double for her sins.”

verses.text: The voice of one crying in the wilderness: “Prepare the way of the Lord; make straight the paths of our God.
parts: The voice of one crying in the wilderness: “Prepare the way of the Lord; make straight the paths of our God.

verses.text: Every valley shall be filled, and every mountain and hill humbled; the crooked places shall be made straight, and the rough places into plains.
parts: Every valley shall be filled, and every mountain and hill humbled; the crooked places shall be made straight, and the rough places into plains.

verses.text: The glory of the Lord shall be revealed, and all flesh shall see the salvation of God; for the Lord has spoken.”
parts: The glory of the Lord shall be revealed, and all flesh shall see the salvation of God; for the Lord has spoken.”

verses.text: The voice said, “Cry out.” So I said, “What shall I cry?” “All flesh is grass, and all man's glory is like the flower of the field.
parts: The voice said, “Cry out.” So I said, “What shall I cry?” “All flesh is grass, and all man's glory is like the flower of the field.

verses.text: The grass withers, the flower fades,
parts: The grass withers, the flower fades,

verses.text: but the word of our God abides forever.’
parts: but the word of our God abides forever.’

verses.text: O you who bring good tidings to Zion, go into the high mountain; O you who bring good tidings to Jerusalem, lift up your voice with strength; lift it up, be not afraid.
parts: O you who bring good tidings to Zion, go into the high mountain; O you who bring good tidings to Jerusalem, lift up your voice with strength; lift it up, be not afraid.

verses.text: Behold, the Lord is coming with strength, and His arm is with authority.
parts: Behold, the Lord is coming with strength, and His arm is with authority.

verses.text: He will feed His flock like a shepherd and gather the lambs with His arm; and He will comfort those with young.
parts: He will feed His flock like a shepherd and gather the lambs with His arm; and He will comfort those with young.

verses.text: Who measured the water in His hand, and heaven with a span, and all the earth with a handful? Who weighed the mountains in scales and the vales in a balance?Who knows the Lord's mind, and who was His counselor; who advises Him?Or with whom does He take counsel, who instructs Him, and who teaches Him judgment and shows Him the way of understanding?The nations are as a drop in a bucket and are counted as the balance of a scale; and they are counted as spittle.Lebanon is not sufficient to burn, nor its four-footed animals sufficient for a whole burnt offering.All nations are as nothing and are counted as nothing.To whom then will you liken the Lord, and to what likeness will you compare Him?Has the workman made an image, or has the goldsmith overspread it with gold, gilding it, making a likeness of Him?For the workman chooses wood that will not rot, and skillfully seeks to prepare a carved image that will not totter.Will you not know? Will you not hear? Has it not been told you from the beginning? Do you not know the foundations of the earth?It is He who possesses the circle of the earth, and its inhabitants are like grasshoppers. It is He who stretches out heaven like a vault, and spreads them out like a tent to dwell in.He makes the rulers He establishes to rule to be as nothing; He makes the earth as nothing.Scarcely shall they be planted, scarcely shall they be sown, scarcely shall their stock take root in the earth, when He shall also blow on them and they will wither, and the whirlwind will take them away like stubble.“Now then, to whom will you liken Me, that I should be exalted?” says the Holy One.Lift up your eyes on high, and see. Who displayed these things? He who brings forth their host by number; He who calls them all by name. From the greatness of His glory to the strength of His might, nothing escapes Your notice.

verses.text: For why do you say, O Jacob, and speak, O Israel, saying, “My way is hidden from God, and my God took away my judgment and departed”?So then, have you not known? Have you not heard? The everlasting God, the God who created the ends of the earth, neither hungers nor is weary. His understanding is unsearchable.He gives strength to the hungry, and sorrow to those who do not grieve.Even the youths shall faint and be weary, and the elect shall be without strength.But those who wait on God shall renew their strength; they shall mount up with wings like eagles; they shall run and not be weary; they shall walk and not hunger.
