verses.text: He will pursue them, and the way of His feet will pass through in peace.
parts: He will pursue them, and the way of His feet will pass through in peace.

verses.text: Who worked and performed these things?
parts: Who worked and performed these things?

verses.text: The Gentiles saw His righteousness and feared.
parts: The Gentiles saw His righteousness and feared.

verses.text: each one judging for his neighbor, that he might help his brother.
parts: each one judging for his neighbor, that he might help his brother.

verses.text: ‘The craftsman is strong, as is the metalworker who strikes with the hammer and forges at the same time.’ Sometimes one will say, ‘It is put together well, and they fastened it with nails.
parts: ‘The craftsman is strong, as is the metalworker who strikes with the hammer and forges at the same time.’ Sometimes one will say, ‘It is put together well, and they fastened it with nails.

verses.text: “But you, O Israel, are My servant, and Jacob, whom I chose, the seed of Abraham, whom I loved.I took you from the ends of the earth, and called you from its height. I said to you, ‘You are My servant. I chose you, and have not forsaken you.Fear not, for I am with you. Do not go astray, for I am your God who strengthens you; and I will help and secure you with My righteous right hand.’ Behold, all your adversaries shall be put to shame and disgraced. For they shall be as though they did not exist, and all who oppose you shall perish.You shall seek but not find the men who rage against you, for those who war against you shall be as though they did not exist.For I am your God who holds your right hand, saying to you, ‘Fear not.’ O Jacob, O Israel, few in number, I will help you, and I will redeem you, O Israel,” says God.“Behold, I will make you like new saw-shaped threshing wheels of a wagon, and you shall thresh the mountains and beat the hills to powder, and make them like chaff.You shall crush them, and the wind shall carry them away; and the whirlwind will scatter them; but you shall be glad among the saints, O Israel.The poor and needy shall rejoice exceedingly, for when they shall seek water, but there is none, and their tongues are parched with thirst, I, the Lord God, will hear them; I, the God of Israel, will not forsake them.But I will open rivers in the mountain and fountains in the midst of the plains. I will make the desert into marsh-meadows, and the dry land into aqueducts.I will plant the cedar, the box-tree, the myrtle, the cypress, and the white poplar in the waterless ground, so they may see, know, consider, and understand together that the Lord’S hand did all these things; and the Holy One of Israel created them.

verses.text: “Your judgment draws near,” says the Lord God. “Your counsels draw near,” says the King of Jacob.“Let them draw near, and tell you what will happen; or tell you about the former things, what they were; and we shall be able to understand and know them, and know what are the last things; and tell us about the future.Declare to us things coming at the end of time, and we will know you are gods. Do good and evil, and we shall marvel and see it together.Where do you come from? Where does your work come from? They chose you, an abomination out of the earth.I raised up one from the north and from the rising of the sun, and they shall be called by My name. Let the rulers come, and you will be trampled down, as potter's clay and as a potter tramples down the clay.For who will declare the things from the beginning, that we may also know the former things and say they are true? There is no one who foretells or hears your words.I will give Zion the power to rule, and I shall comfort Jerusalem in the way.For I looked, and there was no one from the nations or from their idols to declare it to me. If I should ask them where they are from, they would not answer me.For they are the ones who made you, so you think, and in vain they are leading you astray.

parts: For they are the ones who made you, so you think, and in vain they are leading you astray.

verses.text: He will not cry out, nor raise His voice, nor cause His voice to be heard outside.
parts: He will not cry out, nor raise His voice, nor cause His voice to be heard outside.

verses.text: A bruised reed He will not break, and smoking flax He will not quench; but He will bring forth judgment in truth.
parts: A bruised reed He will not break, and smoking flax He will not quench; but He will bring forth judgment in truth.

verses.text: He will shine forth and not be broken until He establishes judgment in the earth; and in his name the Gentiles will hope.”
parts: He will shine forth and not be broken until He establishes judgment in the earth; and in his name the Gentiles will hope.”

verses.text: Thus says the Lord God, who made heaven and established it, who made firm the earth and the things in it, and who gives breath to the people in it, and spirit to those who walk on it:
parts: Thus says the Lord God, who made heaven and established it, who made firm the earth and the things in it, and who gives breath to the people in it, and spirit to those who walk on it:

verses.text: “I, the Lord God, called You in righteousness, and will hold Your hand.
parts: “I, the Lord God, called You in righteousness, and will hold Your hand.

verses.text: to open the eyes of the blind, to bring out prisoners who are bound, and those who sit in darkness from the prison house.
parts: to open the eyes of the blind, to bring out prisoners who are bound, and those who sit in darkness from the prison house.

verses.text: I am the Lord God; this is My name.
parts: I am the Lord God; this is My name.

verses.text: Behold, things from of old came to pass, and new things I will declare.
parts: Behold, things from of old came to pass, and new things I will declare.

verses.text: Sing to the Lord a new song, you His realm. Glorify His name from the ends of the earth, you who go down to the sea and sail on it, you coastlands and you who inhabit them.Be glad, O desert and its villages, the homesteads and those inhabiting Kedar. Those who dwell in Petra shall be glad; they shall shout from the tops of the mountains.They will give glory to God and declare His virtues in the coastlands.The Lord God of powers shall go forth and crush war. He shall stir up His zeal, and cry out against His enemies with strength.I held My peace, and I will not always be silent and restrain Myself. Now I will be steadfast, like a woman in labor. I shall amaze and dry up together.I will make the rivers into coastlands and dry up marsh-meadows.I will bring the blind by a way they did not know, and will cause them to tread paths they have not known. I will turn darkness into light for them, and make crooked places straight. These things I will do for them, and not forsake them.But they turned back. You be greatly ashamed who trust in carved images, who say to the molded images, “You are our gods.”

verses.text: Hear, you deaf; and look up, you blind, that you may see.Who is blind but My servants, or deaf but those who rule over them? The servants of God are blind.You often see, but do not take heed. Your ears were opened, but you do not listen.The Lord God wished to show His righteousness and to magnify His praise.But I saw the people robbed and plundered, for there was a snare in the secret chambers everywhere, and in the houses at the same time, where they hid them. They became as plunder, and there was no one to rescue the prey, and no one who said, “Restore them.” Who among you will give ear to these things? Who will listen and hear what is coming?Who gave Jacob for plunder, and Israel to those who plunder him? Was it not God, against whom they sinned? For they would not walk in His ways nor heed His law.So He brought upon them the fury of His wrath, and war overpowered them. They set them on fire all around, yet none of them knew or took it to heart.

verses.text: For I am the Lord your God, the Holy One of Israel, who saves you.
parts: For I am the Lord your God, the Holy One of Israel, who saves you.

verses.text: Since you were precious in My sight, you became glorious, and I love you.
parts: Since you were precious in My sight, you became glorious, and I love you.

verses.text: Fear not, for I am with you; I will bring your seed from the east, and gather you from the west.

verses.text: I will say to the north, ‘Bring them,’ and to the south, ‘Do not keep them back.
parts: I will say to the north, ‘Bring them,’ and to the south, ‘Do not keep them back.

verses.text: For in my glory I prepared him, and formed and made him.
parts: For in my glory I prepared him, and formed and made him.

verses.text: I brought forth the blind people, and their eyes are alike blind, and their ears deaf.”
parts: I brought forth the blind people, and their eyes are alike blind, and their ears deaf.”

verses.text: All the nations are gathered together, and the rulers shall be assembled from among them.
parts: All the nations are gathered together, and the rulers shall be assembled from among them.

verses.text: “You are My witnesses, and I am a witness,” says the Lord God, “and My Servant whom I chose, that you may know and believe, and understand that I am He.
parts: “You are My witnesses, and I am a witness,” says the Lord God, “and My Servant whom I chose, that you may know and believe, and understand that I am He.

verses.text: I am God, and besides Me there is no one who saves.
parts: I am God, and besides Me there is no one who saves.

verses.text: I proclaimed, and I saved.
parts: I proclaimed, and I saved.

verses.text: “Even from the beginning, there is no one who can deliver out of My hands; I will work, and who will reverse it?”
parts: “Even from the beginning, there is no one who can deliver out of My hands; I will work, and who will reverse it?”

verses.text: Thus says the Lord God who redeems you, the Holy One of Israel: “For your sake I will send to Babylon and arouse all who flee, and the Chaldeans shall be bound in ships.I am the Lord God, your Holy One, who made known your King, O Israel.” Thus says the Lord, who makes a way in the sea and a path in the mighty water, who brings forth chariot and horse, and a mighty host. But they fell asleep, and shall not arise. They are extinguished, like a quenched lamp-wick: “Do not remember the former things, nor reason about the things of old.Behold, I will do new things, which shall now spring forth, and you shall know them; and l will make a road in the desert and rivers in the waterless places.The wild animals of the field will bless Me, the sirens and the daughters of sparrows, because I gave water in the wilderness and rivers in the waterless place, to give drink to My race, My chosen, My people whom I preserved to declare My virtues.I have not called on you now, O Jacob, neither have I made you grow weary, O Israel.You have not brought Me sheep for your whole burnt offerings, neither have you glorified Me with your sacrifices, nor have I wearied you with frankincense.Neither have you purchased sweet incense for Me with money, nor have I desired the fat of your sacrifices; but I set before you your sins and wrongdoings.I, even I, am He who blots out your lawlessness, and I will not remember them.But remember, and let us judge; tell your lawless first, that you may be made righteous.Your fathers first, and their rulers after them, acted lawlessly against Me.Your rulers defiled My holy things; thus I gave Jacob to destruction and Israel for reproach.”

verses.text: For I will give water to the thirsty who walk in a waterless place.
parts: For I will give water to the thirsty who walk in a waterless place.

verses.text: They will spring up like grass in the midst of the water and like willows by the flowing water.
parts: They will spring up like grass in the midst of the water and like willows by the flowing water.

verses.text: One will say, ‘I am God's,’ and will call himself by the name of Jacob.
parts: One will say, ‘I am God's,’ and will call himself by the name of Jacob.

verses.text: Thus says God, the King of Israel who delivers him, the God of hosts: “I am the first and the last; besides Me there is no God.Who is just as I am? Then let him stand, let him call and prepare for Me that from which I made man forever, and let them declare to you the things that are coming before they come.Do not hide yourselves. Have you not paid attention from the beginning, and have I not declared it to you? You are My witnesses, if there is a God besides Me? Indeed there was none.All who form and carve gods are useless, and they desire things which shall not profit them; but they will be ashamed.They all create a god and carve unprofitable things.All by whom they were made are withered, and let all the deaf among men be gathered together. Let them stand together, and be ashamed and dishonored together.For the craftsman sharpens his iron tool, and fashions the idol with his axe, and pierces it with the awl. He works it with the strength of his arm, and will hunger and grow weak, and will not drink water.The craftsman selects his wood and stretches out his rule, and fits it with glue. He makes it like the form of a man and according to the bloom of youth, to set it up in the house.The wood he cut from the forest which the Lord planted, and the rain made it grow, so as to be for men to burn and to take some of it to warm himself. They kindle it, and bake bread for themselves; but he works into gods what is left and worships them.They burn half of it in the fire, and with the other half they bake bread for themselves. They roast meat on it, eat and are satisfied. He even warms himself and says, ‘I am comfortable, because I am warm, and have seen the fire.’ And the rest of it he makes into a carved god, and worships it and prays to it, and says, ‘Deliver me, for you are my god.’ They do not know how to discern because they shut their eyes, so as not to see with their eyes or understand with their heart.No one considered in his heart, neither pondered in his soul, nor knew in his discernment, that he burned half of it in the fire, baked bread on its coals, roasted meat and ate, and then made the rest of it an abomination; and they worship it.Know this: their heart is ashes; they go astray, and no one can deliver his soul. See, you will not say, ‘There is a lie in my right hand.’
parts: Thus says God, the King of Israel who delivers him, the God of hosts: “I am the first and the last; besides Me there is no God.
Who is just as I am? Then let him stand, let him call and prepare for Me that from which I made man forever, and let them declare to you the things that are coming before they come.

Do not hide yourselves. Have you not paid attention from the beginning, and have I not declared it to you? You are My witnesses, if there is a God besides Me? Indeed there was none.All who form and carve gods are useless, and they desire things which shall not profit them; but they will be ashamed.They all create a god and carve unprofitable things.All by whom they were made are withered, and let all the deaf among men be gathered together. Let them stand together, and be ashamed and dishonored together.For the craftsman sharpens his iron tool, and fashions the idol with his axe, and pierces it with the awl. He works it with the strength of his arm, and will hunger and grow weak, and will not drink water.The craftsman selects his wood and stretches out his rule, and fits it with glue. He makes it like the form of a man and according to the bloom of youth, to set it up in the house.The wood he cut from the forest which the Lord planted, and the rain made it grow, so as to be for men to burn and to take some of it to warm himself. They kindle it, and bake bread for themselves; but he works into gods what is left and worships them.They burn half of it in the fire, and with the other half they bake bread for themselves. They roast meat on it, eat and are satisfied. He even warms himself and says, ‘I am comfortable, because I am warm, and have seen the fire.’ And the rest of it he makes into a carved god, and worships it and prays to it, and says, ‘Deliver me, for you are my god.’ They do not know how to discern because they shut their eyes, so as not to see with their eyes or understand with their heart.No one considered in his heart, neither pondered in his soul, nor knew in his discernment, that he burned half of it in the fire, baked bread on its coals, roasted meat and ate, and then made the rest of it an abomination; and they worship it.Know this: their heart is ashes; they go astray, and no one can deliver his soul. See, you will not say, ‘There is a lie in my right hand.’

verses.text: “Remember these things, O Jacob and Israel, for you are My servant; I formed you to be My servant; therefore, you, O Israel, do not forget Me.For behold, I blotted out your lawlessness like a cloud and your sins like darkness. Return to Me, and I will redeem you.Be glad, O heavens, for the Lord had mercy on Israel. Sound the trumpet, you foundations of the earth; shout with gladness, you mountains and hills and every tree on them. For God redeemed Jacob, and Israel will be glorified.”
parts: “Remember these things, O Jacob and Israel, for you are My servant; I formed you to be My servant; therefore, you, O Israel, do not forget Me.

For behold, I blotted out your lawlessness like a cloud and your sins like darkness. Return to Me, and I will redeem you.Be glad, O heavens, for the Lord had mercy on Israel. Sound the trumpet, you foundations of the earth; shout with gladness, you mountains and hills and every tree on them. For God redeemed Jacob, and Israel will be glorified.”

verses.text: For behold, I blotted out your lawlessness like a cloud and your sins like darkness.
parts: For behold, I blotted out your lawlessness like a cloud and your sins like darkness.

verses.text: Be glad, O heavens, for the Lord had mercy on Israel.
parts: Be glad, O heavens, for the Lord had mercy on Israel.

verses.text: Thus says the Lord, who redeems you and forms you from the womb: “I am the Lord, who accomplishes all things, who alone stretched out the heavens and established the earth.Who else will scatter abroad the sign of ventriloquists and the divinations from their heart, turning their shrewd men backward and making their counsel foolishness?Who else establishes the word of His servant, proving the counsel of His messengers to be true? Who else says to Jerusalem, ‘You shall be inhabited,’ and to the cities of Judah, ‘You shall be built, and the desert places shall spring forth’?Who else says to the deep, ‘You shall be dried up, and I will dry up your rivers’?Who else tells Cyrus to be wise, and do all My will, and says to Jerusalem, ‘You will be built, and I shall lay the foundation of My holy house’?”
parts: Thus says the Lord, who redeems you and forms you from the womb: “I am the Lord, who accomplishes all things, who alone stretched out the heavens and established the earth.Who else will scatter abroad the sign of ventriloquists and the divinations from their heart, turning their shrewd men backward and making their counsel foolishness?Who else establishes the word of His servant, proving the counsel of His messengers to be true? Who else says to Jerusalem, ‘You shall be inhabited,’ and to the cities of Judah, ‘You shall be built, and the desert places shall spring forth’?Who else says to the deep, ‘You shall be dried up, and I will dry up your rivers’?Who else tells Cyrus to be wise, and do all My will, and says to Jerusalem, ‘You will be built, and I shall lay the foundation of My holy house’?”

verses.text: “I will go before you and level mountains; I will break in pieces the gates of bronze and shatter the bars of iron.
parts: “I will go before you and level mountains; I will break in pieces the gates of bronze and shatter the bars of iron.

verses.text: I will give you the treasures of darkness, and I shall open unseen secret things to you, so you may know I, the Lord God, who call you by your name, am the God of Israel.
parts: I will give you the treasures of darkness, and I shall open unseen secret things to you, so you may know I, the Lord God, who call you by your name, am the God of Israel.

verses.text: For Jacob My servant's sake, and Israel My elect, I will call you by your name; I will accept you, though you have not known Me.
parts: For Jacob My servant's sake, and Israel My elect, I will call you by your name; I will accept you, though you have not known Me.

verses.text: For I am the Lord God.
parts: For I am the Lord God.

verses.text: I will call you by name and accept you, so those who come from the east and the west may know there is none besides Me.
parts: I will call you by name and accept you, so those who come from the east and the west may know there is none besides Me.

verses.text: I am He who prepared light and made darkness, who makes peace and creates troublesome things.
parts: I am He who prepared light and made darkness, who makes peace and creates troublesome things.

verses.text: Let heaven above be glad, and let the clouds sprinkle righteousness.
parts: Let heaven above be glad, and let the clouds sprinkle righteousness.

verses.text: “As the clay of a potter, what better thing have I created? Will the one plowing plow all day? Shall the clay say to the potter who forms it, ‘What are you making, for you neither work nor have hands?’As though one should say to his father, ‘What will you beget?’ Or to his mother, ‘What will you bring forth?’ ” Thus says the Lord God, the Holy One of Israel, who made the things that are to come: “Ask Me concerning My sons and daughters; and command Me concerning the works of My hands.I made the earth and mankind upon it. With My hand I established heaven and commanded all the stars.I raised him up to be a king with righteousness, and all his ways are right. He shall build My city and return the captivity of My people, not with ransoms or gifts,” says the Lord of hosts.

verses.text: Thus says the Lord of hosts: “Egypt labored for you, and the merchandise of the Ethiopians and of the Sabeans, men of stature, shall pass over to you. They shall be your servants and follow behind you, bound with handcuffs. They shall bow down and make supplication to you, because God is with you; and they shall say, ‘There is no God besides You.For You are God, the God of Israel, the Savior, yet we knew it not.’ All who oppose him shall be ashamed and disgraced and shall walk in shame. Be restored to Me, O coastlands.Israel is saved by the Lord with an everlasting salvation. They will not be ashamed or disgraced forever.”

Be restored to Me, O coastlands.Israel is saved by the Lord with an everlasting salvation. They will not be ashamed or disgraced forever.”

verses.text: For thus says the Lord, who made heaven—this is the God who formed the earth and made it. He established it, and did not make it in vain, but formed it to be inhabited—“I Am, and there is no other.I have not spoken in secret, nor in a dark place of the earth. I did not say to the seed of Jacob, ‘Seek Me in vain.’ I Am, I am the Lord who speaks righteousness and declares the truth.Assemble yourselves and come. Take counsel together, you who are saved from among the nations. Those who set up the wood of their carved image have no knowledge, and pray to gods who do not save.If they will declare, let them draw near, so as to know together who caused these things to be heard from the beginning. At that time it was told you, ‘I am God, and there is no other besides Me; there is no righteous God and Savior in addition to Me.’ Return to Me, and you shall be saved, you who are from the ends of the earth. For I am God, and there is no other.I swore by Myself: righteousness will truly proceed from my mouth; My words shall not be turned away, that to Me every knee shall bow, and every tongue shall confess to God, saying, ‘Righteousness and glory shall come to Him, and all who separate themselves from Him shall be put to shame.’ All the seed of the children of Israel shall be made righteous by the Lord, and glorified in God.”
parts: For thus says the Lord, who made heaven—this is the God who formed the earth and made it. He established it, and did not make it in vain, but formed it to be inhabited—“I Am, and there is no other.I have not spoken in secret, nor in a dark place of the earth. I did not say to the seed of Jacob, ‘Seek Me in vain.’ I Am, I am the Lord who speaks righteousness and declares the truth.Assemble yourselves and come. For I am God, and there is no other.I swore by Myself: righteousness will truly proceed from my mouth; My words shall not be turned away, that to Me every knee shall bow, and every tongue shall confess to God, saying, ‘Righteousness and glory shall come to Him, and all who separate themselves from Him shall be put to shame.’ All the seed of the children of Israel shall be made righteous by the Lord, and glorified in God.”

verses.text: to the hungry, the exhausted and those who have no strength together, who shall not be able to save themselves from war, but who themselves are led away as captives.
parts: to the hungry, the exhausted and those who have no strength together, who shall not be able to save themselves from war, but who themselves are led away as captives.

verses.text: “Listen to Me, O house of Jacob and all the remnant of Israel, both those taken from the womb and those instructed from childhood,even to your old age: I Am, and even to your gray hairs, I Am. I bear you; I made you and will forgive you. I will take you up and save you.To whom will you liken Me? Look what you contrived, you who went astray.Those who contribute gold from a purse and silver on a scale, and count them out by weight, and who hire a goldsmith, they make things with their hands, and bowing down, they worship them.They bear it on their shoulders and go; and if they set it somewhere, it remains there and never moves. Though one cries out to it, yet it cannot answer, nor save him from his troubles.Remember these things and groan. Repent, you who go astray; return in your heart.Remember the former things of old, for I am God, and there is no other besides Me, declaring beforehand the latter events before they come to pass and are accomplished together. I say, ‘All My counsel shall stand, and I will do whatever I will to do,calling a bird from the east and from a land afar off.’ For what I purpose to do, I speak and bring it about, and create and do it. Thus I brought him and proposed his way.Listen to Me, you stubborn-hearted who are far from righteousness.I bring My righteousness near, and My salvation shall not delay. I give salvation in Zion and to Israel for glory.

verses.text: Take a millstone and grind meal.
parts: Take a millstone and grind meal.

verses.text: Your shame will be uncovered, and your disgrace will be seen.
parts: Your shame will be uncovered, and your disgrace will be seen.

verses.text: He who delivers you has spoken; the Lord of hosts is His name, the Holy One of Israel.
parts: He who delivers you has spoken; the Lord of hosts is His name, the Holy One of Israel.

verses.text: Sit down, you who are pierced to the heart; enter into darkness, O daughter of the Chaldeans; for you shall no longer be called the strength of a kingdom.
parts: Sit down, you who are pierced to the heart; enter into darkness, O daughter of the Chaldeans; for you shall no longer be called the strength of a kingdom.

verses.text: I was provoked at My people; you profaned My inheritance; I gave them into your hand.
parts: I was provoked at My people; you profaned My inheritance; I gave them into your hand.

verses.text: You said, ‘I shall be a princess forever,’ but you did not understand these things in your heart, nor remember the latter end.
parts: You said, ‘I shall be a princess forever,’ but you did not understand these things in your heart, nor remember the latter end.

verses.text: Therefore hear this now, you who are given to pleasures, who sit in confidence, who says in her heart, ‘I am, and there is no other; I shall not sit as a widow, nor shall I know bereavement.’
parts: Therefore hear this now, you who are given to pleasures, who sit in confidence, who says in her heart, ‘I am, and there is no other; I shall not sit as a widow, nor shall I know bereavement.’

verses.text: But now these two things shall come upon you in a moment, in one day: widowhood and the loss of children.
parts: But now these two things shall come upon you in a moment, in one day: widowhood and the loss of children.

verses.text: and your hope of evil.
parts: and your hope of evil.

verses.text: Therefore destruction shall come upon you, and you shall not know the pit into which you will fall.
parts: Therefore destruction shall come upon you, and you shall not know the pit into which you will fall.

verses.text: Stand now with your enchantments and the multitude of your sorceries which you learned from your youth, if you will be able to profit from this.
parts: Stand now with your enchantments and the multitude of your sorceries which you learned from your youth, if you will be able to profit from this.

verses.text: You are wearied in your counsels.
parts: You are wearied in your counsels.

verses.text: Behold, all these shall be burned like sticks in a fire, and they shall not deliver their soul from the flame.
parts: Behold, all these shall be burned like sticks in a fire, and they shall not deliver their soul from the flame.

verses.text: You grew weary in your traffic from youth, and each man led himself astray, but there shall be no salvation for you.
parts: You grew weary in your traffic from youth, and each man led himself astray, but there shall be no salvation for you.

verses.text: and who are devoted to the name of the holy city, and lean on the God of Israel for support—the Lord of hosts is His name.
parts: and who are devoted to the name of the holy city, and lean on the God of Israel for support—the Lord of hosts is His name.

verses.text: I still declare the former things that went forth from My mouth, and they became well known.
parts: I still declare the former things that went forth from My mouth, and they became well known.

verses.text: I know you are stubborn, and your neck is an iron nerve; and your forehead is made of bronze.
parts: I know you are stubborn, and your neck is an iron nerve; and your forehead is made of bronze.

verses.text: Yet I told you long ago, before it came to pass.
parts: Yet I told you long ago, before it came to pass.

verses.text: You heard all this, yet you knew not what you heard.
parts: You heard all this, yet you knew not what you heard.

verses.text: Now they come to pass, and not long ago, but you did not listen to these things in former days.
parts: Now they come to pass, and not long ago, but you did not listen to these things in former days.

verses.text: You neither know nor understand, nor have I opened your ears from the beginning.
parts: You neither know nor understand, nor have I opened your ears from the beginning.

verses.text: For My name's sake, I will show you My anger, and I will bring before you my glorious acts, so as not to utterly destroy you.
parts: For My name's sake, I will show you My anger, and I will bring before you my glorious acts, so as not to utterly destroy you.

verses.text: Behold, I sold you, but not for silver; and I delivered you from the furnace of poverty.
parts: Behold, I sold you, but not for silver; and I delivered you from the furnace of poverty.

verses.text: For My own sake, I will do this for you, because My name is profaned; and I will not give My glory to another.
parts: For My own sake, I will do this for you, because My name is profaned; and I will not give My glory to another.

verses.text: Listen to Me, O Jacob and Israel, whom I call: I am the first, and I am forever.
parts: Listen to Me, O Jacob and Israel, whom I call: I am the first, and I am forever.

verses.text: My hand also laid the foundation of the earth, and My right hand established heaven.
parts: My hand also laid the foundation of the earth, and My right hand established heaven.

verses.text: All shall be gathered and hear: Who declared these things to them?
parts: All shall be gathered and hear: Who declared these things to them?

verses.text: I have spoken, I have called him, I have brought him, and made his way prosper.
parts: I have spoken, I have called him, I have brought him, and made his way prosper.

verses.text: Come near to Me, hear this: I have not spoken in secret from the beginning, nor did I speak in a dark place of the earth.
parts: Come near to Me, hear this: I have not spoken in secret from the beginning, nor did I speak in a dark place of the earth.

verses.text: Thus says the Lord who delivers you, the Holy One of Israel: “I am your God, who showed you how to find the way wherein you should walk.
parts: Thus says the Lord who delivers you, the Holy One of Israel: “I am your God, who showed you how to find the way wherein you should walk.

verses.text: If only you had heeded My commandments, then your peace would be like a river, and your righteousness as a wave of the sea.
parts: If only you had heeded My commandments, then your peace would be like a river, and your righteousness as a wave of the sea.

verses.text: Your seed would also be like the sand, and the offspring of your womb like the dust of the ground.
parts: Your seed would also be like the sand, and the offspring of your womb like the dust of the ground.

verses.text: Go forth from Babylon, you who are fleeing from the Chaldeans. Proclaim a voice of gladness and let it become well known. Proclaim it to the end of the earth, and say, “The Lord delivered His servant Jacob.” If they shall thirst, He will lead them through the desert, and water shall flow from the rock for them. He will split the rock, the water shall flow, and My people will drink.“There is no rejoicing,” says the Lord, “for the ungodly.”

He will split the rock, the water shall flow, and My people will drink.“There is no rejoicing,” says the Lord, “for the ungodly.”

verses.text: He made My mouth like a sharp sword, and hid Me under the shadow of His hand.
parts: He made My mouth like a sharp sword, and hid Me under the shadow of His hand.

verses.text: He said to me, ‘You are My servant, O Israel, in whom I will be glorified.’
parts: He said to me, ‘You are My servant, O Israel, in whom I will be glorified.’

verses.text: Then I said, ‘I have labored in vain and spent My strength for nothing.
parts: Then I said, ‘I have labored in vain and spent My strength for nothing.

verses.text: Now thus says the Lord—who formed Me from the womb to be His Servant, and to bring Jacob and Israel back to Him (for I shall gather and glorify them before the Lord, and My God shall be My strength)—
parts: Now thus says the Lord—who formed Me from the womb to be His Servant, and to bring Jacob and Israel back to Him (for I shall gather and glorify them before the Lord, and My God shall be My strength)—

verses.text: indeed He says, ‘It is a great thing for You to be called My Servant, to establish the tribes of Jacob, and to restore the dispersion of Israel.
parts: indeed He says, ‘It is a great thing for You to be called My Servant, to establish the tribes of Jacob, and to restore the dispersion of Israel.

verses.text: Thus says the Lord, who delivers You, the God of Israel: “Sanctify Him who despises His life, who is abhorred by the nations and by the servants of rulers. Kings shall see Him and rise, and rulers also shall worship Him for the Lord's sake. For the Holy One of Israel is faithful, and He chose You.” Thus says the Lord: “In an acceptable time I heard You, and in the day of salvation I helped You. I give You as a covenant to the Gentiles, to establish the earth and to inherit the inheritance of the desert;saying to those in bonds, ‘Go forth,’ and to those in darkness, ‘Reveal yourselves.’ They shall feed along all their roads, and their pasture shall be along all the paths.They shall not hunger, neither shall they thirst, nor shall the burning heat of the sun strike them; but He who has mercy on them will comfort them; and He shall lead them by the fountains of waters.I will make every mountains as a road, and every path as a pasture for them.Behold, these come from afar, these from the north and these from the sea, and the others from the land of the Persians.” Be glad, O heavens, and rejoice exceedingly, O earth. Let the mountains break out in gladness, and the hills in righteousness. For the Lord had mercy on His people, and comforted the humble of His people.

verses.text: But Zion said, “The Lord forsook me, and the Lord forgot me.” “Will a woman forget her child, so as not to have mercy on the offspring of her womb? But even if a woman should forget these things, nevertheless, I shall not forget you,” says the Lord.“Behold, I painted your walls on My hands, and you are continually before Me.It will be rebuilt quickly by your destroyers, and those who laid you waste shall go away from you.Lift up your eyes round about, and look on them. Behold, they gather together and come to you. As I live,” says the Lord, “you shall clothe yourselves with them, and put them on as a bride's attire.For your deserts and your ruined and fallen places will now be too confined because of the inhabitants; and those who swallowed you up will go far away.For your children, whom you lost, will say in your ears, ‘The place is too narrow for me. Make me a place where I may dwell.’ Then you will say in your heart, ‘Who has begotten these for me? For I am childless and a widow, but who reared these for me? I was left alone, but these, where are they from?’ ”
