verses.text: Thus says the Lord: “Behold, I lift My hand to the Gentiles, and I will set up My signal to the islands. They shall bring your sons in their bosom, and your daughters shall be carried on their shoulders.Kings shall be your foster fathers, and their queens your nursing mothers. They shall bow down to you upon the face of the earth, and lick up the dust of your feet. Then you will know I am the Lord, and you will not be ashamed.Will someone take spoils from a mighty man? If anyone should take someone captive unjustly, will that one be saved?” Thus says the Lord: “If someone should take a mighty man captive, he will also take his spoils; and he will also save the one taken captive by that strong man. For I will plead your cause and deliver your children.Those who oppressed you will eat their own flesh and drink their own blood as new wine; and all flesh shall perceive that I am the Lord, who delivers you and supports the strength of Jacob.”
parts: Thus says the Lord: “Behold, I lift My hand to the Gentiles, and I will set up My signal to the islands. They shall bring your sons in their bosom, and your daughters shall be carried on their shoulders.

Kings shall be your foster fathers, and their queens your nursing mothers. They shall bow down to you upon the face of the earth, and lick up the dust of your feet. Then you will know I am the Lord, and you will not be ashamed.Will someone take spoils from a mighty man? If anyone should take someone captive unjustly, will that one be saved?” Thus says the Lord: “If someone should take a mighty man captive, he will also take his spoils; and he will also save the one taken captive by that strong man. For I will plead your cause and deliver your children.Those who oppressed you will eat their own flesh and drink their own blood as new wine; and all flesh shall perceive that I am the Lord, who delivers you and supports the strength of Jacob.”

verses.text: Kings shall be your foster fathers, and their queens your nursing mothers.
parts: Kings shall be your foster fathers, and their queens your nursing mothers.

verses.text: Will someone take spoils from a mighty man?
parts: Will someone take spoils from a mighty man?

verses.text: Thus says the Lord: “If someone should take a mighty man captive, he will also take his spoils; and he will also save the one taken captive by that strong man.
parts: Thus says the Lord: “If someone should take a mighty man captive, he will also take his spoils; and he will also save the one taken captive by that strong man.

verses.text: Those who oppressed you will eat their own flesh and drink their own blood as new wine; and all flesh shall perceive that I am the Lord, who delivers you and supports the strength of Jacob.”
parts: Those who oppressed you will eat their own flesh and drink their own blood as new wine; and all flesh shall perceive that I am the Lord, who delivers you and supports the strength of Jacob.”

verses.text: Why, when I came, was there no man?
parts: Why, when I came, was there no man?

verses.text: I clothe heaven with darkness and make its covering like sackcloth.”
parts: I clothe heaven with darkness and make its covering like sackcloth.”

verses.text: “The Lord gives Me the tongue of the learned, so as to know when to speak a word at a fitting time; and He causes My ear to listen each morning.The Lord's instruction opens My ears, and I am not disobedient, nor do I contradict Him.
parts: “The Lord gives Me the tongue of the learned, so as to know when to speak a word at a fitting time; and He causes My ear to listen each morning.
The Lord's instruction opens My ears, and I am not disobedient, nor do I contradict Him.

verses.text: The Lord's instruction opens My ears, and I am not disobedient, nor do I contradict Him.
parts: The Lord's instruction opens My ears, and I am not disobedient, nor do I contradict Him.

verses.text: “I gave My back to whips, and My cheeks to blows; and I turned not away My face from the shame of spitting.The Lord became My helper; therefore, I was not disgraced. But I made My face like a solid rock and knew I would not be ashamed.For He who pronounces Me righteous draws near. Who is he who judges Me? Let him oppose Me at the same time. Who is he who judges Me? Let him come near Me.Behold, the Lord will help Me. Who will harm Me? Behold, all of you will grow old like a garment, and old age will devour you, as a moth does a garment.
parts: “I gave My back to whips, and My cheeks to blows; and I turned not away My face from the shame of spitting.

The Lord became My helper; therefore, I was not disgraced. But I made My face like a solid rock and knew I would not be ashamed.For He who pronounces Me righteous draws near. Who is he who judges Me? Let him oppose Me at the same time. Who is he who judges Me? Let him come near Me.Behold, the Lord will help Me. Who will harm Me? Behold, all of you will grow old like a garment, and old age will devour you, as a moth does a garment.

verses.text: The Lord became My helper; therefore, I was not disgraced.
parts: The Lord became My helper; therefore, I was not disgraced.

verses.text: For He who pronounces Me righteous draws near.
parts: For He who pronounces Me righteous draws near.

verses.text: Behold, the Lord will help Me.
parts: Behold, the Lord will help Me.

verses.text: “Who among you fears the Lord? Let him listen to the voice of His Servant. You who walk in darkness and have no light, trust in the name of the Lord and rely upon God.Behold, all of you kindle a fire and feed a flame. Walk in the light of your fire and the flame you kindled. This happened to you for My sake, and you shall lie down in sorrow.
parts: “Who among you fears the Lord? Let him listen to the voice of His Servant. You who walk in darkness and have no light, trust in the name of the Lord and rely upon God.Behold, all of you kindle a fire and feed a flame. Walk in the light of your fire and the flame you kindled. This happened to you for My sake, and you shall lie down in sorrow.

verses.text: Behold, all of you kindle a fire and feed a flame.
parts: Behold, all of you kindle a fire and feed a flame.

verses.text: Look to Abraham our father and to Sarah who bore you, for he was first, and I called and blessed him, and loved and multiplied him.
parts: Look to Abraham our father and to Sarah who bore you, for he was first, and I called and blessed him, and loved and multiplied him.

verses.text: And now I will comfort you, O Zion, and I comforted all her desert places; and I shall make her desert places like the Garden of the Lord.
parts: And now I will comfort you, O Zion, and I comforted all her desert places; and I shall make her desert places like the Garden of the Lord.

verses.text: Listen to Me, listen, O My people and kings, give ear to Me, for law shall proceed from Me, and My judgment as the light of the Gentiles.
parts: Listen to Me, listen, O My people and kings, give ear to Me, for law shall proceed from Me, and My judgment as the light of the Gentiles.

verses.text: My righteousness draws near quickly, and My salvation will go forth as light, and the Gentiles will hope in My arm, and the coastlands shall wait for Me and hope in My arm.
parts: My righteousness draws near quickly, and My salvation will go forth as light, and the Gentiles will hope in My arm, and the coastlands shall wait for Me and hope in My arm.

verses.text: Lift up your eyes to heaven, and look to the earth below, for heaven is solid as smoke, and the earth will grow old like a garment; and the inhabitants of the earth shall die, as do these things.
parts: Lift up your eyes to heaven, and look to the earth below, for heaven is solid as smoke, and the earth will grow old like a garment; and the inhabitants of the earth shall die, as do these things.

verses.text: Listen to Me, My people who know judgment, in whose heart is My law.
parts: Listen to Me, My people who know judgment, in whose heart is My law.

verses.text: For as a garment will be devoured by time, and as wool will be devoured by a moth, so shall they be devoured.
parts: For as a garment will be devoured by time, and as wool will be devoured by a moth, so shall they be devoured.

verses.text: Awake, awake, O Jerusalem, and put on the strength of your arm. Awake as in the beginning of days, as in the generations of old.Are You not He who dried up the sea, the abundant water of the deep, and made the depths of the sea a road of passage for those who were delivered and redeemed?For with the Lord's help, they shall return and come to Zion with gladness and everlasting joy; for exceeding joy. Praise and gladness shall come on them, and pain, grief, and sighing shall depart from them.“I Am, I am the Lord who comforts you. Know who it is you feared, for you were fearful of mortal man and the son of man, those who wither like grass.You forgot the God who made you, who made heaven and laid the foundations of the earth, but all your days you feared the angry face of him who oppressed you. For he plotted to take you away, but now where is the anger of him who oppressed you?For when you are saved, he will not stand still nor tarry.For I am your God who troubles the sea and causes the waves to roar. The Lord of hosts is My name.I will put My words in your mouth, and protect you under the shadow of My hand, with which I established heaven, and laid the foundation of the earth. I will say to Zion, ‘You are My people.’
parts: Awake, awake, O Jerusalem, and put on the strength of your arm. Awake as in the beginning of days, as in the generations of old.Are You not He who dried up the sea, the abundant water of the deep, and made the depths of the sea a road of passage for those who were delivered and redeemed?For with the Lord's help, they shall return and come to Zion with gladness and everlasting joy; for exceeding joy. Praise and gladness shall come on them, and pain, grief, and sighing shall depart from them.“I Am, I am the Lord who comforts you. Know who it is you feared, for you were fearful of mortal man and the son of man, those who wither like grass.

You forgot the God who made you, who made heaven and laid the foundations of the earth, but all your days you feared the angry face of him who oppressed you. For he plotted to take you away, but now where is the anger of him who oppressed you?For when you are saved, he will not stand still nor tarry.For I am your God who troubles the sea and causes the waves to roar. The Lord of hosts is My name.I will put My words in your mouth, and protect you under the shadow of My hand, with which I established heaven, and laid the foundation of the earth. I will say to Zion, ‘You are My people.’

verses.text: Are You not He who dried up the sea, the abundant water of the deep, and made the depths of the sea a road of passage for those who were delivered and redeemed?
parts: Are You not He who dried up the sea, the abundant water of the deep, and made the depths of the sea a road of passage for those who were delivered and redeemed?

verses.text: For with the Lord's help, they shall return and come to Zion with gladness and everlasting joy; for exceeding joy.
parts: For with the Lord's help, they shall return and come to Zion with gladness and everlasting joy; for exceeding joy.

verses.text: “I Am, I am the Lord who comforts you.
parts: “I Am, I am the Lord who comforts you.

verses.text: You forgot the God who made you, who made heaven and laid the foundations of the earth, but all your days you feared the angry face of him who oppressed you.
parts: You forgot the God who made you, who made heaven and laid the foundations of the earth, but all your days you feared the angry face of him who oppressed you.

verses.text: For when you are saved, he will not stand still nor tarry.
parts: For when you are saved, he will not stand still nor tarry.

verses.text: For I am your God who troubles the sea and causes the waves to roar.
parts: For I am your God who troubles the sea and causes the waves to roar.

verses.text: I will put My words in your mouth, and protect you under the shadow of My hand, with which I established heaven, and laid the foundation of the earth.
parts: I will put My words in your mouth, and protect you under the shadow of My hand, with which I established heaven, and laid the foundation of the earth.

verses.text: Awake, awake, rise up, O Jerusalem, who drank the cup of anger from the Lord's hand, for you drank the cup of destruction, the drinking-vessel of My anger, and emptied it out.There was no one to comfort you from all the children you bore, and there was no one to take hold of your hand, not even from among all the children you reared.These two things are against you. Who will sympathize with you in your grief? Misfortune and affliction, famine and sword! Who will comfort you?Your sons are at a loss, and they lie asleep at the end of every street like a half-boiled beet, full of the Lord's anger and forsaken because of the Lord God.Therefore listen, you who are humbled and drunk, but not from wine.Thus says the Lord God who judges His people: “Behold, I took the cup of destruction, the cup of My anger, from your hand, and it shall no longer be imposed on you to drink from it.I will put it into the hands of those who wronged and humbled you, those who said to your soul, ‘Bow down as we pass by.’ So you put your back parallel with the ground to those who passed by.”
parts: Awake, awake, rise up, O Jerusalem, who drank the cup of anger from the Lord's hand, for you drank the cup of destruction, the drinking-vessel of My anger, and emptied it out.

There was no one to comfort you from all the children you bore, and there was no one to take hold of your hand, not even from among all the children you reared.These two things are against you. Who will sympathize with you in your grief? Misfortune and affliction, famine and sword! Who will comfort you?Your sons are at a loss, and they lie asleep at the end of every street like a half-boiled beet, full of the Lord's anger and forsaken because of the Lord God.Therefore listen, you who are humbled and drunk, but not from wine.Thus says the Lord God who judges His people: “Behold, I took the cup of destruction, the cup of My anger, from your hand, and it shall no longer be imposed on you to drink from it.I will put it into the hands of those who wronged and humbled you, those who said to your soul, ‘Bow down as we pass by.’ So you put your back parallel with the ground to those who passed by.”

verses.text: There was no one to comfort you from all the children you bore, and there was no one to take hold of your hand, not even from among all the children you reared.
parts: There was no one to comfort you from all the children you bore, and there was no one to take hold of your hand, not even from among all the children you reared.

verses.text: These two things are against you.
parts: These two things are against you.

verses.text: Your sons are at a loss, and they lie asleep at the end of every street like a half-boiled beet, full of the Lord's anger and forsaken because of the Lord God.
parts: Your sons are at a loss, and they lie asleep at the end of every street like a half-boiled beet, full of the Lord's anger and forsaken because of the Lord God.

verses.text: Therefore listen, you who are humbled and drunk, but not from wine.
parts: Therefore listen, you who are humbled and drunk, but not from wine.

verses.text: Thus says the Lord God who judges His people: “Behold, I took the cup of destruction, the cup of My anger, from your hand, and it shall no longer be imposed on you to drink from it.
parts: Thus says the Lord God who judges His people: “Behold, I took the cup of destruction, the cup of My anger, from your hand, and it shall no longer be imposed on you to drink from it.

verses.text: I will put it into the hands of those who wronged and humbled you, those who said to your soul, ‘Bow down as we pass by.’ So you put your back parallel with the ground to those who passed by.”
parts: I will put it into the hands of those who wronged and humbled you, those who said to your soul, ‘Bow down as we pass by.’ So you put your back parallel with the ground to those who passed by.”

verses.text: Shake off the dust and rise up.
parts: Shake off the dust and rise up.

verses.text: For thus says the Lord: “You were sold for nothing, and you shall be redeemed without money.”
parts: For thus says the Lord: “You were sold for nothing, and you shall be redeemed without money.”

verses.text: Thus says the Lord: “My people went down to Egypt in former times to sojourn there, and they were taken to the Assyrians by force.”
parts: Thus says the Lord: “My people went down to Egypt in former times to sojourn there, and they were taken to the Assyrians by force.”

verses.text: So now, why are you here?
parts: So now, why are you here?

verses.text: Therefore My people shall know My name in that day, for I am He who speaks.
parts: Therefore My people shall know My name in that day, for I am He who speaks.

verses.text: I am present like springtime in the mountains, like the feet of one who announces a good report of peace, like one who preaches good things, for I will cause Your salvation to be heard, saying, ‘O Zion, your God reigns.’ ”
parts: I am present like springtime in the mountains, like the feet of one who announces a good report of peace, like one who preaches good things, for I will cause Your salvation to be heard, saying, ‘O Zion, your God reigns.’ ”

verses.text: For the voice of those who guard you is raised upward, and with their voice they shall be glad together; for their eyes shall be on watch together when the Lord has mercy on Zion.
parts: For the voice of those who guard you is raised upward, and with their voice they shall be glad together; for their eyes shall be on watch together when the Lord has mercy on Zion.

verses.text: Break forth in gladness together, O desert places of Jerusalem, for the Lord had mercy on her, and has delivered Jerusalem.
parts: Break forth in gladness together, O desert places of Jerusalem, for the Lord had mercy on her, and has delivered Jerusalem.

verses.text: The Lord will reveal His holy arm before all the Gentiles, and all the ends of the earth shall see the salvation of God.
parts: The Lord will reveal His holy arm before all the Gentiles, and all the ends of the earth shall see the salvation of God.

verses.text: Depart, depart, go out from there, and do not touch an unclean thing.
parts: Depart, depart, go out from there, and do not touch an unclean thing.

verses.text: because you shall not go forth with tumult, nor will you go by flight.
parts: because you shall not go forth with tumult, nor will you go by flight.

verses.text: Behold, My Servant shall have wisdom, and He shall be exalted and glorified exceedingly.Just as many shall be astonished at You, so Your form and glory shall be dishonored by men.Thus many nations shall marvel at Him, and kings shall shut their mouth, because they to whom no report was brought concerning Him shall see; and they who did not hear shall understand.
parts: Behold, My Servant shall have wisdom, and He shall be exalted and glorified exceedingly.

Just as many shall be astonished at You, so Your form and glory shall be dishonored by men.Thus many nations shall marvel at Him, and kings shall shut their mouth, because they to whom no report was brought concerning Him shall see; and they who did not hear shall understand.

verses.text: Just as many shall be astonished at You, so Your form and glory shall be dishonored by men.
parts: Just as many shall be astonished at You, so Your form and glory shall be dishonored by men.

verses.text: Thus many nations shall marvel at Him, and kings shall shut their mouth, because they to whom no report was brought concerning Him shall see; and they who did not hear shall understand.
parts: Thus many nations shall marvel at Him, and kings shall shut their mouth, because they to whom no report was brought concerning Him shall see; and they who did not hear shall understand.

verses.text: We proclaimed His presence as a Child, as a Root in a thirsty land.
parts: We proclaimed His presence as a Child, as a Root in a thirsty land.

verses.text: But in comparison to all men, His form was lacking in honor.
parts: But in comparison to all men, His form was lacking in honor.

verses.text: He bears our sins and suffers for us, yet we considered Him to be in pain, suffering, and ill-treatment.
parts: He bears our sins and suffers for us, yet we considered Him to be in pain, suffering, and ill-treatment.

verses.text: But He was wounded because of our lawlessness, and became sick because of our sins.
parts: But He was wounded because of our lawlessness, and became sick because of our sins.

verses.text: All we like sheep have gone astray.
parts: All we like sheep have gone astray.

verses.text: Although He was ill-treated, He opened not His mouth.
parts: Although He was ill-treated, He opened not His mouth.

verses.text: In His humiliation His judgment was taken away, and who will declare His generation?
parts: In His humiliation His judgment was taken away, and who will declare His generation?

verses.text: I will appoint evil men for His burial and rich men for His death, because He committed no lawlessness, nor was deceit found in His mouth.
parts: I will appoint evil men for His burial and rich men for His death, because He committed no lawlessness, nor was deceit found in His mouth.

verses.text: The Lord wishes to cleanse Him of His wound, and if You give an offering for sin, Your soul shall see a long-lived seed.
parts: The Lord wishes to cleanse Him of His wound, and if You give an offering for sin, Your soul shall see a long-lived seed.

verses.text: The Lord wishes to take away the pain of His soul, to show Him light, to form Him with understanding, and to pronounce righteous the Righteous One who serves many well; and He shall bear their sins.
parts: The Lord wishes to take away the pain of His soul, to show Him light, to form Him with understanding, and to pronounce righteous the Righteous One who serves many well; and He shall bear their sins.

verses.text: Therefore He shall inherit many, and will divide the spoil with the strong, because His soul was delivered over to death.
parts: Therefore He shall inherit many, and will divide the spoil with the strong, because His soul was delivered over to death.

verses.text: “Enlarge the place of your tent and courtyard; set it up; do not avoid it; lengthen your ropes and strengthen your pegs.
parts: “Enlarge the place of your tent and courtyard; set it up; do not avoid it; lengthen your ropes and strengthen your pegs.

verses.text: Spread out further to the right and the left, and your seed shall inherit the Gentiles.
parts: Spread out further to the right and the left, and your seed shall inherit the Gentiles.

verses.text: Fear not that you were shamed, neither be confounded and disgraced; for you will forget your former shame and will not remember the disgrace of your widowhood.
parts: Fear not that you were shamed, neither be confounded and disgraced; for you will forget your former shame and will not remember the disgrace of your widowhood.

verses.text: For it is the Lord who is your Maker; the Lord of hosts is His name.
parts: For it is the Lord who is your Maker; the Lord of hosts is His name.

verses.text: The Lord has not called you like a woman forsaken and fainthearted, nor like a wife hated from her youth,” says your God.
parts: The Lord has not called you like a woman forsaken and fainthearted, nor like a wife hated from her youth,” says your God.

verses.text: “I forsook you for a short while, but with great compassion I will have mercy on you.
parts: “I forsook you for a short while, but with great compassion I will have mercy on you.

verses.text: In a little anger I turned away My face from you, but in everlasting compassion I will have mercy on you,” says the Lord who delivered you.
parts: In a little anger I turned away My face from you, but in everlasting compassion I will have mercy on you,” says the Lord who delivered you.

verses.text: “This little anger is to Me as it was at the time of Noah's Flood, when I swore to him regarding the earth, that I would no longer be angry with it, neither would I again threaten to remove its mountains nor move its hills.
parts: “This little anger is to Me as it was at the time of Noah's Flood, when I swore to him regarding the earth, that I would no longer be angry with it, neither would I again threaten to remove its mountains nor move its hills.

verses.text: So neither shall My compassion fail you, nor shall your covenant of peace be removed; for the Lord who is merciful to you has spoken.
parts: So neither shall My compassion fail you, nor shall your covenant of peace be removed; for the Lord who is merciful to you has spoken.

verses.text: “Servile and unstable, you were not comforted. Behold, I am preparing you carbuncle for your stone and sapphire for your foundations,and I will make your battlements jasper and your gates crystal stones, and the enclosing wall of your temple choice stones.I will cause all your children to be taught by God, and your children to be in great peace.You shall be built in righteousness. Keep away from wrongdoing, and you will not be afraid, and trembling shall not come near you.Behold, resident aliens shall come to you because of Me, and they shall flee to you.Behold, I created you, not as a metalworker who blows coals in the fire and brings out a vessel fit for work; and I created you, not for ruin so as to destroy you.I will not prosper any instrument of destruction used against you, and every voice raised against you in judgment, you shall overcome them all; and your adversaries shall be judged guilty. This is the inheritance for those who serve the Lord, and you shall be my righteous ones,” says the Lord.
parts: “Servile and unstable, you were not comforted. Behold, I am preparing you carbuncle for your stone and sapphire for your foundations,

and I will make your battlements jasper and your gates crystal stones, and the enclosing wall of your temple choice stones.I will cause all your children to be taught by God, and your children to be in great peace.You shall be built in righteousness. Keep away from wrongdoing, and you will not be afraid, and trembling shall not come near you.Behold, resident aliens shall come to you because of Me, and they shall flee to you.Behold, I created you, not as a metalworker who blows coals in the fire and brings out a vessel fit for work; and I created you, not for ruin so as to destroy you.I will not prosper any instrument of destruction used against you, and every voice raised against you in judgment, you shall overcome them all; and your adversaries shall be judged guilty. This is the inheritance for those who serve the Lord, and you shall be my righteous ones,” says the Lord.

verses.text: and I will make your battlements jasper and your gates crystal stones, and the enclosing wall of your temple choice stones.
parts: and I will make your battlements jasper and your gates crystal stones, and the enclosing wall of your temple choice stones.

verses.text: I will cause all your children to be taught by God, and your children to be in great peace.
parts: I will cause all your children to be taught by God, and your children to be in great peace.

verses.text: You shall be built in righteousness.
parts: You shall be built in righteousness.

verses.text: Behold, resident aliens shall come to you because of Me, and they shall flee to you.
parts: Behold, resident aliens shall come to you because of Me, and they shall flee to you.

verses.text: Behold, I created you, not as a metalworker who blows coals in the fire and brings out a vessel fit for work; and I created you, not for ruin so as to destroy you.
parts: Behold, I created you, not as a metalworker who blows coals in the fire and brings out a vessel fit for work; and I created you, not for ruin so as to destroy you.

verses.text: I will not prosper any instrument of destruction used against you, and every voice raised against you in judgment, you shall overcome them all; and your adversaries shall be judged guilty.
parts: I will not prosper any instrument of destruction used against you, and every voice raised against you in judgment, you shall overcome them all; and your adversaries shall be judged guilty.

verses.text: Why do you value at the price of money, and give your toil for what does not satisfy?
parts: Why do you value at the price of money, and give your toil for what does not satisfy?

verses.text: Incline your ears and follow my ways.
parts: Incline your ears and follow my ways.

verses.text: Behold, I made him a witness among the Gentiles, a ruler and commander to the Gentiles.
parts: Behold, I made him a witness among the Gentiles, a ruler and commander to the Gentiles.

verses.text: The Gentiles, which did not know you, shall call upon you, and the peoples who did not understand you shall take refuge in you, because of your God, the Holy One of Israel; for He glorified you.”
parts: The Gentiles, which did not know you, shall call upon you, and the peoples who did not understand you shall take refuge in you, because of your God, the Holy One of Israel; for He glorified you.”

verses.text: Seek God, and when you find Him, call upon Him when He draws near to you.Let the ungodly man abandon his ways, and the lawless man his counsels; and let him return to the Lord, and He will have mercy on him; for He shall forgive your sins abundantly.“For My counsels are not as your counsels, neither are your ways My ways,” says the Lord.“But as heaven is distant from earth, so is My way distant from your ways, and your thoughts from My mind.For as rain comes down, or snow from heaven, and does not return until it saturates the earth, and it brings forth and produces, and gives seed to the sower and bread for food,so shall My word be, whatever proceeds from My mouth. It shall not return until it accomplishes whatever I willed, and I shall prosper your ways and My commandments.For you shall go forth with gladness and shall be taught with joy, for the mountains and hills shall exult to receive you with joy; and all the trees of the field shall applaud with their branches.Instead of the broom-tree shall come up the cypress, and instead of the nettle shall come up the myrtle; and the Lord shall be for a name and for an everlasting sign, and He shall not fail.”
parts: Seek God, and when you find Him, call upon Him when He draws near to you.Let the ungodly man abandon his ways, and the lawless man his counsels; and let him return to the Lord, and He will have mercy on him; for He shall forgive your sins abundantly.“For My counsels are not as your counsels, neither are your ways My ways,” says the Lord.

“But as heaven is distant from earth, so is My way distant from your ways, and your thoughts from My mind.For as rain comes down, or snow from heaven, and does not return until it saturates the earth, and it brings forth and produces, and gives seed to the sower and bread for food,

so shall My word be, whatever proceeds from My mouth. It shall not return until it accomplishes whatever I willed, and I shall prosper your ways and My commandments.For you shall go forth with gladness and shall be taught with joy, for the mountains and hills shall exult to receive you with joy; and all the trees of the field shall applaud with their branches.Instead of the broom-tree shall come up the cypress, and instead of the nettle shall come up the myrtle; and the Lord shall be for a name and for an everlasting sign, and He shall not fail.”

verses.text: Let the ungodly man abandon his ways, and the lawless man his counsels; and let him return to the Lord, and He will have mercy on him; for He shall forgive your sins abundantly.
parts: Let the ungodly man abandon his ways, and the lawless man his counsels; and let him return to the Lord, and He will have mercy on him; for He shall forgive your sins abundantly.

verses.text: “For My counsels are not as your counsels, neither are your ways My ways,” says the Lord.
parts: “For My counsels are not as your counsels, neither are your ways My ways,” says the Lord.

verses.text: “But as heaven is distant from earth, so is My way distant from your ways, and your thoughts from My mind.
parts: “But as heaven is distant from earth, so is My way distant from your ways, and your thoughts from My mind.

verses.text: For as rain comes down, or snow from heaven, and does not return until it saturates the earth, and it brings forth and produces, and gives seed to the sower and bread for food,
parts: For as rain comes down, or snow from heaven, and does not return until it saturates the earth, and it brings forth and produces, and gives seed to the sower and bread for food,

verses.text: so shall My word be, whatever proceeds from My mouth.
parts: so shall My word be, whatever proceeds from My mouth.

verses.text: For you shall go forth with gladness and shall be taught with joy, for the mountains and hills shall exult to receive you with joy; and all the trees of the field shall applaud with their branches.
parts: For you shall go forth with gladness and shall be taught with joy, for the mountains and hills shall exult to receive you with joy; and all the trees of the field shall applaud with their branches.

verses.text: Instead of the broom-tree shall come up the cypress, and instead of the nettle shall come up the myrtle; and the Lord shall be for a name and for an everlasting sign, and He shall not fail.”
parts: Instead of the broom-tree shall come up the cypress, and instead of the nettle shall come up the myrtle; and the Lord shall be for a name and for an everlasting sign, and He shall not fail.”

verses.text: Blessed is the man who does these things, and the man who lays hold on them; and who keeps the Sabbaths, so as not to profane them, and keeps his hand free from wrongdoing.”
parts: Blessed is the man who does these things, and the man who lays hold on them; and who keeps the Sabbaths, so as not to profane them, and keeps his hand free from wrongdoing.”

verses.text: Let not the foreigner who is devoted to the Lord say, “The Lord therefore will separate me from His people,” and let not the eunuch say, “I am a withered tree.”
parts: Let not the foreigner who is devoted to the Lord say, “The Lord therefore will separate me from His people,” and let not the eunuch say, “I am a withered tree.”

verses.text: The Lord says this to the eunuchs: “As many as keep My Sabbaths, and choose the things I will, and lay hold of My covenant,
parts: The Lord says this to the eunuchs: “As many as keep My Sabbaths, and choose the things I will, and lay hold of My covenant,

verses.text: I will give them a notable place in My house and within My wall, a place better than that of sons and daughters.
parts: I will give them a notable place in My house and within My wall, a place better than that of sons and daughters.

verses.text: I will also give an eternal name to the foreigners who devote themselves to the Lord, to serve Him and to love His name, to be His male and female servants, and to all who keep My Sabbaths so as not to profane them, and who hold fast to My covenant.
parts: I will also give an eternal name to the foreigners who devote themselves to the Lord, to serve Him and to love His name, to be His male and female servants, and to all who keep My Sabbaths so as not to profane them, and who hold fast to My covenant.

verses.text: I will lead them to My holy mountain and gladden them in My house of prayer.
parts: I will lead them to My holy mountain and gladden them in My house of prayer.

verses.text: says the Lord who gathers the dispersed of Israel; “for I will gather together a congregation to Him.”
parts: says the Lord who gathers the dispersed of Israel; “for I will gather together a congregation to Him.”

verses.text: All you wild animals of the fields and all you wild animals of the thicket, come and eat.See, all are blinded; they do not know how to be discerning; all are dumb dogs unable to bark; dozing on a bed, loving to sleep.They are shameless dogs in their soul and do not know satisfaction. They are evil and have no understanding. All follow their own ways, each according to his own will.
parts: All you wild animals of the fields and all you wild animals of the thicket, come and eat.See, all are blinded; they do not know how to be discerning; all are dumb dogs unable to bark; dozing on a bed, loving to sleep.They are shameless dogs in their soul and do not know satisfaction. They are evil and have no understanding. All follow their own ways, each according to his own will.

verses.text: See, all are blinded; they do not know how to be discerning; all are dumb dogs unable to bark; dozing on a bed, loving to sleep.
parts: See, all are blinded; they do not know how to be discerning; all are dumb dogs unable to bark; dozing on a bed, loving to sleep.

verses.text: They are shameless dogs in their soul and do not know satisfaction.
parts: They are shameless dogs in their soul and do not know satisfaction.

verses.text: His burial shall be in peace, for he was taken from the midst of it.
parts: His burial shall be in peace, for he was taken from the midst of it.

verses.text: “But come here, you lawless sons, a seed of adulterers and of a prostitute.
parts: “But come here, you lawless sons, a seed of adulterers and of a prostitute.

verses.text: In whom did you delight?
parts: In whom did you delight?

verses.text: You are those who call upon their idols under leafy trees and slay their children in the midst of the rocks.
parts: You are those who call upon their idols under leafy trees and slay their children in the midst of the rocks.

verses.text: That is your portion, this is your lot, for you poured out drink offerings to them, and to them you offered up sacrifices; therefore, shall I not be angry for these things?
parts: That is your portion, this is your lot, for you poured out drink offerings to them, and to them you offered up sacrifices; therefore, shall I not be angry for these things?

verses.text: On a high and lofty mountain, there was your bed, and there you carried up your sacrifices.
parts: On a high and lofty mountain, there was your bed, and there you carried up your sacrifices.

verses.text: Also behind the posts of your door, you put your memorials.
parts: Also behind the posts of your door, you put your memorials.

verses.text: and multiplied your fornication with them.
parts: and multiplied your fornication with them.

verses.text: You grew weary with many ways, but you did not say, ‘I will cease strengthening myself,’ for you practiced these things; therefore, you did not supplicate Me.
parts: You grew weary with many ways, but you did not say, ‘I will cease strengthening myself,’ for you practiced these things; therefore, you did not supplicate Me.

verses.text: Whom did you respect and fear, so as to lie to Me, and not remember Me, nor take Me into your heart and mind?
parts: Whom did you respect and fear, so as to lie to Me, and not remember Me, nor take Me into your heart and mind?

verses.text: And I will declare My righteousness, and your evils, which will not profit you.
parts: And I will declare My righteousness, and your evils, which will not profit you.

verses.text: When you cry out, let them deliver you in your tribulation, for wind and storm will take them and carry them all away.
parts: When you cry out, let them deliver you in your tribulation, for wind and storm will take them and carry them all away.

verses.text: They shall say, ‘Cleanse the ways before His face, and take away the obstacles from the way of My people.’ ”
parts: They shall say, ‘Cleanse the ways before His face, and take away the obstacles from the way of My people.’ ”

verses.text: The Lord, the Most High who dwells on high forever, the Holy One among His saints, whose name is the Lord Most High, who rests among His saints, and who gives patience to the fainthearted and life to the broken-hearted, says this:“I will not punish you forever, nor will I always be angry with you, for My Spirit shall go forth from Me, and I made every breath.Because of sin for a time I grieved him, and struck him, and turned away My face from him; and he was grieved, and he went on sorrowful in his ways.I saw his ways, and healed him; and I comforted him, and gave him true comfort.There is peace upon peace to those far off and those near; and the Lord says, ‘I will heal them.’ But wrongdoers shall be tossed here and there by waves, and be unable to rest.There is no joy to the ungodly,” says the Lord God.
parts: The Lord, the Most High who dwells on high forever, the Holy One among His saints, whose name is the Lord Most High, who rests among His saints, and who gives patience to the fainthearted and life to the broken-hearted, says this:

“I will not punish you forever, nor will I always be angry with you, for My Spirit shall go forth from Me, and I made every breath.Because of sin for a time I grieved him, and struck him, and turned away My face from him; and he was grieved, and he went on sorrowful in his ways.I saw his ways, and healed him; and I comforted him, and gave him true comfort.There is peace upon peace to those far off and those near; and the Lord says, ‘I will heal them.’ But wrongdoers shall be tossed here and there by waves, and be unable to rest.There is no joy to the ungodly,” says the Lord God.

verses.text: “I will not punish you forever, nor will I always be angry with you, for My Spirit shall go forth from Me, and I made every breath.
parts: “I will not punish you forever, nor will I always be angry with you, for My Spirit shall go forth from Me, and I made every breath.

verses.text: Because of sin for a time I grieved him, and struck him, and turned away My face from him; and he was grieved, and he went on sorrowful in his ways.
parts: Because of sin for a time I grieved him, and struck him, and turned away My face from him; and he was grieved, and he went on sorrowful in his ways.

verses.text: I saw his ways, and healed him; and I comforted him, and gave him true comfort.
parts: I saw his ways, and healed him; and I comforted him, and gave him true comfort.

verses.text: There is peace upon peace to those far off and those near; and the Lord says, ‘I will heal them.’
parts: There is peace upon peace to those far off and those near; and the Lord says, ‘I will heal them.’

verses.text: But wrongdoers shall be tossed here and there by waves, and be unable to rest.
parts: But wrongdoers shall be tossed here and there by waves, and be unable to rest.

verses.text: There is no joy to the ungodly,” says the Lord God.
parts: There is no joy to the ungodly,” says the Lord God.

verses.text: They seek Me day by day, and desire to know My ways.
parts: They seek Me day by day, and desire to know My ways.

verses.text: saying, ‘Why have we fasted, but You did not see it?
parts: saying, ‘Why have we fasted, but You did not see it?

verses.text: If you fast for condemnations and quarrels, and strike a humble man with your fists, why do you fast to Me as you do today, so your voice may be heard in crying?
parts: If you fast for condemnations and quarrels, and strike a humble man with your fists, why do you fast to Me as you do today, so your voice may be heard in crying?

verses.text: I did not choose this fast, and such a day for a man to humble his soul; nor if you should bow your neck like a ring and spread sackcloth and ashes under yourself, could you thus call such a fast acceptable.
parts: I did not choose this fast, and such a day for a man to humble his soul; nor if you should bow your neck like a ring and spread sackcloth and ashes under yourself, could you thus call such a fast acceptable.

verses.text: I did not choose such a fast,” says the Lord; “rather, loose every bond of wrongdoing; untie the knots of violent dealings; cancel the debts of the oppressed; and tear apart every unjust contract.
parts: I did not choose such a fast,” says the Lord; “rather, loose every bond of wrongdoing; untie the knots of violent dealings; cancel the debts of the oppressed; and tear apart every unjust contract.

verses.text: Break your bread for the hungry, and bring the homeless poor into your house.
parts: Break your bread for the hungry, and bring the homeless poor into your house.

verses.text: Then your light shall break forth as the morning, and your healing shall spring forth quickly.
parts: Then your light shall break forth as the morning, and your healing shall spring forth quickly.

verses.text: Then you shall cry out, and God will hear you.
parts: Then you shall cry out, and God will hear you.

verses.text: and if you give bread to the hungry from your soul, and satisfy the humble soul, then your light shall rise up in the darkness, and your darkness shall be as midday.
parts: and if you give bread to the hungry from your soul, and satisfy the humble soul, then your light shall rise up in the darkness, and your darkness shall be as midday.

verses.text: God shall be with you continually, and you shall be satisfied as your soul desires.
parts: God shall be with you continually, and you shall be satisfied as your soul desires.

verses.text: Your ancient deserts shall be built, and your ancient foundations shall be from generation to generation.
parts: Your ancient deserts shall be built, and your ancient foundations shall be from generation to generation.

verses.text: If you turn away your foot from work because of the Sabbath, so as not to do your desires on the holy day, and if you shall call the Sabbath joyful, holy to your God, and not take away your foot for work, nor speak a word in wrath from your mouth,
parts: If you turn away your foot from work because of the Sabbath, so as not to do your desires on the holy day, and if you shall call the Sabbath joyful, holy to your God, and not take away your foot for work, nor speak a word in wrath from your mouth,

verses.text: then you shall trust in the Lord; and He will bring you to the good things of the land, and feed you with the inheritance of Jacob your father, for the mouth of the Lord has spoken these things.”
parts: then you shall trust in the Lord; and He will bring you to the good things of the land, and feed you with the inheritance of Jacob your father, for the mouth of the Lord has spoken these things.”

verses.text: But your sins stand between you and your God, and He turned His face from you because of your sins, so as not to have mercy.
parts: But your sins stand between you and your God, and He turned His face from you because of your sins, so as not to have mercy.

verses.text: For your hands are defiled with blood, and your fingers with sins; and your lips speak lawlessness, and your tongue plots wrongdoing.
parts: For your hands are defiled with blood, and your fingers with sins; and your lips speak lawlessness, and your tongue plots wrongdoing.

verses.text: No one speaks righteous things, nor is there true judgment.
parts: No one speaks righteous things, nor is there true judgment.

verses.text: They hatch the eggs of asps, and weave a spider's web.
parts: They hatch the eggs of asps, and weave a spider's web.

verses.text: Their web shall not become a garment, nor will they clothe themselves with their works; for their works are works of lawlessness.
parts: Their web shall not become a garment, nor will they clothe themselves with their works; for their works are works of lawlessness.

verses.text: Their feet run swiftly to evil to shed blood.
parts: Their feet run swiftly to evil to shed blood.

verses.text: They do not know the way of peace, and there is no judgment in their ways; for the paths they travel are corrupt, and they do not know peace.
parts: They do not know the way of peace, and there is no judgment in their ways; for the paths they travel are corrupt, and they do not know peace.

verses.text: Therefore judgment departed from them, and righteousness does not lay hold of them.
parts: Therefore judgment departed from them, and righteousness does not lay hold of them.

verses.text: They groped around for a wall like blind men, and like men who have no eyes they groped around.
parts: They groped around for a wall like blind men, and like men who have no eyes they groped around.

verses.text: They shall proceed together like a bear and a dove: We waited for judgment, but there is none, and salvation departed far away from us.
parts: They shall proceed together like a bear and a dove: We waited for judgment, but there is none, and salvation departed far away from us.

verses.text: For our lawlessness is great before You, and our sins oppose us; for our lawlessness is with us, and we know our unrighteous deeds.
parts: For our lawlessness is great before You, and our sins oppose us; for our lawlessness is with us, and we know our unrighteous deeds.

verses.text: We acted in an ungodly manner, and we lied and departed backwards from our God.
parts: We acted in an ungodly manner, and we lied and departed backwards from our God.

verses.text: We departed backwards from judgment, and righteousness stands far off.
parts: We departed backwards from judgment, and righteousness stands far off.

verses.text: Truth was taken away, and they turned away their mind so as not to understand.
parts: Truth was taken away, and they turned away their mind so as not to understand.

verses.text: He also saw there was no man, and He observed, but there was no one to help.
parts: He also saw there was no man, and He observed, but there was no one to help.

verses.text: He put on righteousness as a breastplate and placed the helmet of salvation on His head.
parts: He put on righteousness as a breastplate and placed the helmet of salvation on His head.

verses.text: as a recompense of recompenses, even a rebuke to His adversaries.
parts: as a recompense of recompenses, even a rebuke to His adversaries.

verses.text: Those from the west shall fear the name of the Lord, and those from the east, His glorious name; for the wrath of the Lord shall come like a violent river; it shall come with anger.
parts: Those from the west shall fear the name of the Lord, and those from the east, His glorious name; for the wrath of the Lord shall come like a violent river; it shall come with anger.

verses.text: He who delivers shall come for Zion's sake, and He shall turn back ungodliness from Jacob.
parts: He who delivers shall come for Zion's sake, and He shall turn back ungodliness from Jacob.

verses.text: “This shall be My covenant with them,” says the Lord.
parts: “This shall be My covenant with them,” says the Lord.

verses.text: Behold, darkness and gloom shall cover the earth upon the nations, but the Lord will shine on you; and His glory shall be seen upon you.
parts: Behold, darkness and gloom shall cover the earth upon the nations, but the Lord will shine on you; and His glory shall be seen upon you.

verses.text: Kings shall come to your light, and the Gentiles to your brightness.
parts: Kings shall come to your light, and the Gentiles to your brightness.

verses.text: Lift up your eyes all around, and see your children gathered together.
parts: Lift up your eyes all around, and see your children gathered together.

verses.text: Then you will see, fear and be amazed in your heart, because the wealth of the sea and of nations and peoples shall change their course and turn to you.
parts: Then you will see, fear and be amazed in your heart, because the wealth of the sea and of nations and peoples shall change their course and turn to you.

verses.text: Herds of camels shall come to you, and the camels of Midian and Ephah shall cover you.
parts: Herds of camels shall come to you, and the camels of Midian and Ephah shall cover you.

verses.text: All the sheep of Kedar shall be gathered together to you, and the rams of Nebaioth shall come to you.
parts: All the sheep of Kedar shall be gathered together to you, and the rams of Nebaioth shall come to you.

verses.text: Who are these who fly like clouds and like doves with young?
parts: Who are these who fly like clouds and like doves with young?

verses.text: The coastlands waited for Me, and the ships of Tarshish among the first, to bring your children from afar, and silver and gold with them for the sake of the Lord's name, and because the Holy One of Israel is glorified.
parts: The coastlands waited for Me, and the ships of Tarshish among the first, to bring your children from afar, and silver and gold with them for the sake of the Lord's name, and because the Holy One of Israel is glorified.

verses.text: Foreigners shall build your walls, and their kings shall defend you; for I struck you because of My wrath, and I loved you because of My mercy.
parts: Foreigners shall build your walls, and their kings shall defend you; for I struck you because of My wrath, and I loved you because of My mercy.

verses.text: Your gates shall be opened continually, and they shall not be shut day or night, to bring you the power of the Gentiles, and their kings leading them.
parts: Your gates shall be opened continually, and they shall not be shut day or night, to bring you the power of the Gentiles, and their kings leading them.

verses.text: For the nations and their kings who will not serve you shall perish, and those nations will be utterly desolate.
parts: For the nations and their kings who will not serve you shall perish, and those nations will be utterly desolate.

verses.text: The glory of Lebanon shall come to you, with the cypress, the pine, and the cedar together, to glorify My holy place.
parts: The glory of Lebanon shall come to you, with the cypress, the pine, and the cedar together, to glorify My holy place.

verses.text: The sons of those who humbled and provoked you shall go to you in fear, and you shall be called City of the Lord, Zion of the Holy One of Israel.
parts: The sons of those who humbled and provoked you shall go to you in fear, and you shall be called City of the Lord, Zion of the Holy One of Israel.

verses.text: Because you were forsaken and hated, and there was no one to help you, therefore I will make you an eternal joy, the gladness of generations to generations.
parts: Because you were forsaken and hated, and there was no one to help you, therefore I will make you an eternal joy, the gladness of generations to generations.

verses.text: You shall drink the milk of the Gentiles and eat the wealth of kings.
parts: You shall drink the milk of the Gentiles and eat the wealth of kings.

verses.text: Instead of bronze, I will bring you gold, and instead of iron, I will bring you silver, and instead of wood, I will bring you bronze, and instead of stones, iron.
parts: Instead of bronze, I will bring you gold, and instead of iron, I will bring you silver, and instead of wood, I will bring you bronze, and instead of stones, iron.

verses.text: Unrighteousness shall no longer be heard in your land, neither destruction nor distress within your boundaries, but your walls shall be called Salvation, and your gates Sculptured Work.
parts: Unrighteousness shall no longer be heard in your land, neither destruction nor distress within your boundaries, but your walls shall be called Salvation, and your gates Sculptured Work.

verses.text: The sun shall no longer be your light by day, nor shall the rising of the moon shine on you at night, but the Lord shall be your everlasting light, and God, your glory.
parts: The sun shall no longer be your light by day, nor shall the rising of the moon shine on you at night, but the Lord shall be your everlasting light, and God, your glory.

verses.text: For your sun shall no longer set, nor shall your moon be eclipsed, for the Lord shall be your everlasting light, and the days of your mourning shall be fulfilled.
parts: For your sun shall no longer set, nor shall your moon be eclipsed, for the Lord shall be your everlasting light, and the days of your mourning shall be fulfilled.

verses.text: Also your people shall all be righteous, and they shall inherit the land forever, guarding what they planted, the works of their hands, for glory.
parts: Also your people shall all be righteous, and they shall inherit the land forever, guarding what they planted, the works of their hands, for glory.

verses.text: The few in number shall become thousands, and the lesser shall become a great nation.
parts: The few in number shall become thousands, and the lesser shall become a great nation.

verses.text: to declare the acceptable year of the Lord, the day of recompense, and to comfort all who mourn;
parts: to declare the acceptable year of the Lord, the day of recompense, and to comfort all who mourn;

verses.text: to give those who mourn in Zion glory instead of ashes, the oil of gladness to those who mourn; the garment of glory instead of a spirit of indifference.
parts: to give those who mourn in Zion glory instead of ashes, the oil of gladness to those who mourn; the garment of glory instead of a spirit of indifference.

verses.text: They shall build the ancient deserts, raise up those formerly abandoned, and renew the desert cities that laid waste for generations.
parts: They shall build the ancient deserts, raise up those formerly abandoned, and renew the desert cities that laid waste for generations.

verses.text: Foreigners shall come and shepherd your sheep, and aliens shall be your plowmen and vinedressers;
parts: Foreigners shall come and shepherd your sheep, and aliens shall be your plowmen and vinedressers;

verses.text: but you shall be called priests of the Lord and the ministers of God.
parts: but you shall be called priests of the Lord and the ministers of God.

verses.text: So they shall inherit the land a second time, and eternal gladness shall be upon their head.
parts: So they shall inherit the land a second time, and eternal gladness shall be upon their head.

verses.text: For I am the Lord, who loves righteousness and hates robberies of wrongdoing.
parts: For I am the Lord, who loves righteousness and hates robberies of wrongdoing.

verses.text: Their seed and their offspring shall be known among the Gentiles.
parts: Their seed and their offspring shall be known among the Gentiles.

verses.text: and they shall have exceeding gladness in the Lord.”
parts: and they shall have exceeding gladness in the Lord.”

verses.text: As the earth causes its flower to grow, and as a garden its seeds, so shall the Lord cause righteousness to rise up, and exceeding joy before all the Gentiles.
parts: As the earth causes its flower to grow, and as a garden its seeds, so shall the Lord cause righteousness to rise up, and exceeding joy before all the Gentiles.

verses.text: The Gentiles will see your righteousness, and kings your glory; and one will call you by your new name, which the Lord shall name.
parts: The Gentiles will see your righteousness, and kings your glory; and one will call you by your new name, which the Lord shall name.

verses.text: You shall also be a crown of beauty in the Lord's hand, and the diadem of a kingdom in the hand of your God.
parts: You shall also be a crown of beauty in the Lord's hand, and the diadem of a kingdom in the hand of your God.

verses.text: You shall no longer be called Forsaken, and your land shall not be called Desert; for you shall be called My Will, and in your land, the Inhabited Earth.
parts: You shall no longer be called Forsaken, and your land shall not be called Desert; for you shall be called My Will, and in your land, the Inhabited Earth.

verses.text: As a young man lives in wedlock with a virgin, so shall your sons dwell with you, and as a bridegroom rejoices over his bride, so the Lord shall rejoice over you.
parts: As a young man lives in wedlock with a virgin, so shall your sons dwell with you, and as a bridegroom rejoices over his bride, so the Lord shall rejoice over you.

verses.text: I will place guards on your walls all day and all night, O Jerusalem, who shall never keep silent in the remembrance of the Lord.
parts: I will place guards on your walls all day and all night, O Jerusalem, who shall never keep silent in the remembrance of the Lord.

verses.text: For there shall be no one like you, O Jerusalem, when He amends and makes you the pride of the earth.
parts: For there shall be no one like you, O Jerusalem, when He amends and makes you the pride of the earth.

verses.text: The Lord swore by His right hand and by the strength of His arm, “I will not give your grain and your food to your enemies, and the sons of foreigners shall not drink your wine for which you labored;
parts: The Lord swore by His right hand and by the strength of His arm, “I will not give your grain and your food to your enemies, and the sons of foreigners shall not drink your wine for which you labored;

verses.text: but rather, those who gather the food shall eat it and praise the Lord, and those who gather the grapes shall drink their wine in My holy courts.
parts: but rather, those who gather the food shall eat it and praise the Lord, and those who gather the grapes shall drink their wine in My holy courts.

verses.text: Go through My gates, make a way for My people, throw the stones off the road, and lift up a standard for the Gentiles.”
parts: Go through My gates, make a way for My people, throw the stones off the road, and lift up a standard for the Gentiles.”

verses.text: For behold, the Lord caused this to be heard to the ends of the earth: “Say to the daughter of Zion, ‘Behold, your Savior is come, and has His reward, and His work before His face.’ ”
parts: For behold, the Lord caused this to be heard to the ends of the earth: “Say to the daughter of Zion, ‘Behold, your Savior is come, and has His reward, and His work before His face.’ ”

verses.text: One shall call them a holy people, the redeemed of the Lord, and you shall be called a City Sought for and Not Forsaken.
parts: One shall call them a holy people, the redeemed of the Lord, and you shall be called a City Sought for and Not Forsaken.

verses.text: Why are Your garments red and Your apparel as one who treads in a winepress?
parts: Why are Your garments red and Your apparel as one who treads in a winepress?

verses.text: “I am full of the treading of grapes, and there is no man with Me among the nations.
parts: “I am full of the treading of grapes, and there is no man with Me among the nations.

verses.text: For the day of recompense has come upon them, and the year of redemption has arrived.
parts: For the day of recompense has come upon them, and the year of redemption has arrived.

verses.text: I looked, but there was no helper; and I observed, but there was no one to help; therefore, My arm delivered them, and My anger was suddenly present.
parts: I looked, but there was no helper; and I observed, but there was no one to help; therefore, My arm delivered them, and My anger was suddenly present.

verses.text: So I trampled them in My wrath and brought their blood down to the ground.”
parts: So I trampled them in My wrath and brought their blood down to the ground.”

verses.text: I remembered the Lord's mercy, the praises of the Lord in all things in which the Lord recompenses us. The Lord is a good judge to the house of Israel, and He deals with us according to His mercy, and according to the multitude of His righteousness.He said, “Surely My people, My children, have not rejected Me?” So He became their salvation.Not an elder or an angel, but the Lord Himself saved them from all their tribulation, because He loved them and spared them. He redeemed and took them up, and lifted them up all the days of old.Yet they disobeyed Him and grieved His Holy Spirit. So He turned against them with hostility and waged war on them.Then He remembered the days of old, He who brought up the shepherd of His sheep from the land. Where is He who put His Holy Spirit in them?Where is He who led Moses with His right hand, the arm of His glory? He overpowered the water by His presence to make for Himself an everlasting name.He brought them through the deep, like a horse through the desert, yet they did not grow weary.Like cattle through the plain, the Spirit came down from the Lord and guided them. Thus You led Your people, to make Yourself a glorious name.
parts: I remembered the Lord's mercy, the praises of the Lord in all things in which the Lord recompenses us. The Lord is a good judge to the house of Israel, and He deals with us according to His mercy, and according to the multitude of His righteousness.

He said, “Surely My people, My children, have not rejected Me?” So He became their salvation.Not an elder or an angel, but the Lord Himself saved them from all their tribulation, because He loved them and spared them. He redeemed and took them up, and lifted them up all the days of old.Yet they disobeyed Him and grieved His Holy Spirit. So He turned against them with hostility and waged war on them.Then He remembered the days of old, He who brought up the shepherd of His sheep from the land. Where is He who put His Holy Spirit in them?
Where is He who led Moses with His right hand, the arm of His glory? He overpowered the water by His presence to make for Himself an everlasting name.

He brought them through the deep, like a horse through the desert, yet they did not grow weary.Like cattle through the plain, the Spirit came down from the Lord and guided them. Thus You led Your people, to make Yourself a glorious name.

verses.text: Return from heaven, and look from Your holy and glorious dwelling-place. Where are Your zeal and Your strength; where is the multitude of Your mercy and Your compassion, so as to be patient with us?You are our Father, although Abraham did not know us, and Israel did not acknowledge us; but You, O Lord, are our Father. You delivered us, and from the beginning Your name was upon us.Why have you led us astray, O Lord, from Your path, and hardened our hearts so as not to fear You? Return for the sake of Your servants, for the sake of the tribes of Your inheritance,that we may inherit a small portion of Your holy mountain.For our adversaries trampled down Your sanctuary, and we have become as we were from the beginning, when You did not rule us, neither did we call upon Your name.If You open heaven, trembling shall take hold of the mountains before You, and they shall melt as wax melts before the fire.
parts: Return from heaven, and look from Your holy and glorious dwelling-place. Where are Your zeal and Your strength; where is the multitude of Your mercy and Your compassion, so as to be patient with us?

You delivered us, and from the beginning Your name was upon us.Why have you led us astray, O Lord, from Your path, and hardened our hearts so as not to fear You? verses.text: When You do glorious things, trembling shall take hold of the mountains because of You.
parts: When You do glorious things, trembling shall take hold of the mountains because of You.

verses.text: From of old we have not heard, nor have our eyes seen any God but You, and Your works which You shall do for those who wait for Your mercy.
parts: From of old we have not heard, nor have our eyes seen any God but You, and Your works which You shall do for those who wait for Your mercy.

verses.text: For mercy shall meet with those who do righteousness, and they shall remember your ways.
parts: For mercy shall meet with those who do righteousness, and they shall remember your ways.

verses.text: We all are become as unclean, and all our righteousness is like a filthy rag.
parts: We all are become as unclean, and all our righteousness is like a filthy rag.

verses.text: There is no one who calls upon Your name and who remembers to take hold of You; for You turned away Your face from us, and delivered us over because of our sins.
parts: There is no one who calls upon Your name and who remembers to take hold of You; for You turned away Your face from us, and delivered us over because of our sins.

verses.text: And now, O Lord, You are our Father, and all we are clay, the work of Your hands.
parts: And now, O Lord, You are our Father, and all we are clay, the work of Your hands.

verses.text: Do not be exceedingly angry with us, and do not remember our sins in an opportune time.
parts: Do not be exceedingly angry with us, and do not remember our sins in an opportune time.

verses.text: The city of Your holy place has become a desert.
parts: The city of Your holy place has become a desert.

verses.text: The house, our holy place and the glory our father blessed, has been burnt with fire, and all our glorious things have become extinct.
parts: The house, our holy place and the glory our father blessed, has been burnt with fire, and all our glorious things have become extinct.

verses.text: You tolerated all this, O Lord, and were silent; and You humbled us exceedingly.
parts: You tolerated all this, O Lord, and were silent; and You humbled us exceedingly.

verses.text: I stretched out My hands the whole day long to a people who disobeyed and contradicted Me, who did not walk in the true way, but after their sins.
parts: I stretched out My hands the whole day long to a people who disobeyed and contradicted Me, who did not walk in the true way, but after their sins.

verses.text: This is a people who provoke Me continually to My face.
parts: This is a people who provoke Me continually to My face.

verses.text: and they sleep in graves and caves for the sake of dreams, they who eat swine's flesh and the sauce of their sacrifices, which defiles all their vessels;
parts: and they sleep in graves and caves for the sake of dreams, they who eat swine's flesh and the sauce of their sacrifices, which defiles all their vessels;

verses.text: who say, ‘Stay away from me; do not come near me, for I am clean.’ This is the smoke of My anger; a fire burns in it all day long.
parts: who say, ‘Stay away from me; do not come near me, for I am clean.’ This is the smoke of My anger; a fire burns in it all day long.

verses.text: Behold, it is written before Me: I will not be silent,” says the Lord, “until I repay into their bosom their sins and the sins of their fathers,
parts: Behold, it is written before Me: I will not be silent,” says the Lord, “until I repay into their bosom their sins and the sins of their fathers,

verses.text: who burned incense on the mountains and reproached Me on the hills.
parts: who burned incense on the mountains and reproached Me on the hills.

verses.text: Thus says the Lord: “As the grape shall be found in a cluster, and they shall say, ‘Do not destroy it, for there is a blessing from the Lord in it,’ so shall I do for the sake of him who serves Me. For his sake I will not destroy them all.I will bring forth the seed of Jacob and the seed of Judah, and they shall inherit My holy mountain. My elect shall inherit it, and My servants shall dwell there.There shall be in the forest a fold of flocks, and the valley of Achor shall be for the resting place of herds for My people who sought Me.But you are those who forsook Me, and forget My holy mountain, and prepare a table for the devil, and fill a drink-offering to Fortune.I will deliver you to the sword, and all of you shall fall in the slaughter; because I called you, but you did not obey; I spoke, but you refused to listen. You did evil in My sight, and did not choose the things I willed.”
parts: Thus says the Lord: “As the grape shall be found in a cluster, and they shall say, ‘Do not destroy it, for there is a blessing from the Lord in it,’ so shall I do for the sake of him who serves Me. You did evil in My sight, and did not choose the things I willed.”

verses.text: Therefore, thus says the Lord: “Behold, My servants shall eat, but you shall hunger. Behold, My servants shall drink, but you shall thirst. Behold, My servants shall be glad, but you shall be ashamed.Behold, My servants shall rejoice exceedingly in gladness, but you shall cry out because of the pain in your heart; and you shall wail from the crushing of your spirit.For you shall leave your name as an example of excess to My elect, and the Lord shall destroy you. But those who serve Him shall be called by a new name, which shall be blessed upon the earth. For they shall bless the true God, and those who swear upon the earth shall swear by the true God; for they shall forget their former tribulation, and it shall not come into their heart.
parts: Therefore, thus says the Lord: “Behold, My servants shall eat, but you shall hunger. Behold, My servants shall drink, but you shall thirst. Behold, My servants shall be glad, but you shall be ashamed.Behold, My servants shall rejoice exceedingly in gladness, but you shall cry out because of the pain in your heart; and you shall wail from the crushing of your spirit.For you shall leave your name as an example of excess to My elect, and the Lord shall destroy you. But those who serve Him shall be called by a new name, which shall be blessed upon the earth. For they shall bless the true God, and those who swear upon the earth shall swear by the true God; for they shall forget their former tribulation, and it shall not come into their heart.

verses.text: “For there shall be a new heaven and a new earth, and they shall not remember the former things, nor shall these things come into their heart.But they shall find gladness and exceeding joy in her, for behold, I will make Jerusalem an exceeding joy, and My people gladness.I will rejoice exceedingly in Jerusalem, and I will be glad in My people. There shall no longer be heard in her a voice of weeping, nor a voice of crying.There shall not be the untimely death of a child there, nor shall there be an old man who does not fulfill his time. For a young man shall be a hundred years old, but a sinner who dies at a hundred years old shall be cursed.They shall build houses and dwell in them; and they shall plant vineyards and eat their produce.But they shall not build, and others inhabit; and they shall not plant, and others eat. For according to the days of the tree of life, so shall be the days of My people, and the works of their labors shall not grow old.My elect shall not labor in vain, nor shall they bear children to be a curse; for they are a seed blessed by God; and their offspring shall be with them.It shall be, before they cry out, I will listen to them; while they are still speaking, I will say, ‘What is it?’ The wolves and lambs shall feed together, and the lion, like the ox, shall eat chaff; and the serpent, the ground as bread. They shall not injure, neither destroy in My holy mountain,” says the Lord.

verses.text: For My hand made all these things, and all these things are Mine,” says the Lord; “and upon whom will I show respect, but to the humble and the peaceful and to him who trembles at My words.
parts: For My hand made all these things, and all these things are Mine,” says the Lord; “and upon whom will I show respect, but to the humble and the peaceful and to him who trembles at My words.

verses.text: But the lawless man who sacrifices a calf is as he who kills a dog; and he who offers a grain offering, as he who offers the blood of a pig; and he who offers incense for a memorial, as he who is a blasphemer.
parts: But the lawless man who sacrifices a calf is as he who kills a dog; and he who offers a grain offering, as he who offers the blood of a pig; and he who offers incense for a memorial, as he who is a blasphemer.

verses.text: But I will choose their mockeries, and I will repay them; because I called, but they did not obey Me; I spoke, but they did not listen; but they did evil in My sight, and things I did not will, they chose.”
parts: But I will choose their mockeries, and I will repay them; because I called, but they did not obey Me; I spoke, but they did not listen; but they did evil in My sight, and things I did not will, they chose.”

verses.text: Hear the word of the Lord, you who tremble at His word. Speak, our brethren, to those who hate us and detest us, that the Lord's name may be glorified and seen in their gladness, so they may be ashamed.A voice of crying from the city, a voice from the temple, the voice of the Lord is fully repaying His enemies.“Before she travails in labor to give birth, before the pain of birth pangs comes on, she escapes it and bears a male.Who has heard such a thing, and who has seen anything like this? Has the earth travailed in one day, or has a nation given birth at once? For Zion travailed and gave birth to her children.But I raised this expectation, yet you did not remember Me,” says the Lord. “Behold, do I not cause one woman to beget, but another to be sterile?” says God.“Be glad, O Jerusalem, and celebrate holy days in her. All you who love her, rejoice exceedingly, and all you who mourn over her;that you may nurse and be satisfied by the breast of her consolation; that you may take pleasure in nursing because of the entrance of her glory.” For thus says the Lord: “Behold, I will turn to them like a river of peace and like a brook, to flood them with the glory of the Gentiles. Their children shall be taken up on shoulders and comforted on knees.Like someone a mother comforts, so also will I comfort you, and you shall be comforted in Jerusalem.” You shall see, and your heart will rejoice. Your bones shall rise up like a pasture, and the Lord's hand shall be known by those who fear Him; but He shall threaten the disobedient.

verses.text: For behold, the Lord shall come like a fire, and His chariots like a sudden blast of wind, to render His vengeance with anger and His renunciation with a flame of fire.For all the earth shall be judged in the fire of the Lord, and all flesh with His sword; and many shall be wounded by the Lord.“Those who purify and cleanse themselves in the gardens and porches, who eat the meat of a pig or any abomination, they shall be destroyed together at the same time,” says the Lord; “and I know their works and their reasoning. I am coming to gather all the nations and tongues, and they shall come and see My glory.And I will leave signs upon them, and those among them who are saved, I will send forth to the Gentiles: to Tarshish, and Pul and Lud and Tubal, and to Greece and to the coastlands far off, to those who have not heard My name, nor seen My glory; and they shall declare My glory among the Gentiles.They shall bring your brethren from among all the Gentiles as a gift to the Lord, with horses and chariots, in litters drawn by mules and covered with sunshades, to the holy city of Jerusalem,” says the Lord, “just as the children of Israel would bring Me their sacrifices with psalms into the house of the Lord.I shall take some of them to be My priests and Levites,” says the Lord.“For just as the new heaven and the new earth which I make shall remain before Me,” says the Lord, “so shall your seed and your name remain.It shall come to pass from month to month and from Sabbath to Sabbath, all flesh shall worship before Me in Jerusalem,” says the Lord.“They shall go forth and see the dead bodies of the men who transgressed against Me, for their worm shall not die, and their fire shall not be extinguished; and they shall be a vision to all flesh.”
